review: Food is below average for a Red Robin, there are better ones. At our last visit, we sat very close to the kitchen area. I suspect their shift just started. The manager did this "rah-rah" thing for the employees where he/she gathered them all together. Fine. The problem was is that he distracted our waitress who forgot most of our order. I point it out to the waitress when the meal came and suddenly the manager is apologizing for the waitress. They tried to make it right, but frankly, too little too late. Your mileage may vary. This was in 2011.
This Red Robin was pretty good service and the burgers were great as usual!

My husband, two teenage girls and I are probably in here about 4 times minimum a month and  have only once been disappointed in the food.  When I brought it up to the manager (Bernice), she graciously removed the cost of meal from our bill and gave us certificates for appetizers and desserts. Bernice is always hard working and has a super positive attitude about dealing with most everyone she everyone she interacts with.  The waiters there are pretty efficient and really do not make us wait too long.  I invite anyone who gripes about customer service to try working for customers just to see how frustrating it can be.  One finds that not everyone can be made happy and are just doomed to be miserable and are rarely satisfied.

Went to eat with a couple friends was partly satisfied. The food was not bad it was actually pretty good I had the bbq bacon burger. The service was what made my experience horrible. Our server spent more time talkin to his coworkers then helping us out....To top it off homeboy was too busy touching his wiener instead of trying to get us our check. Not too sure I'll be back
Poor service at the bar  (late dinner hour:  8:30pm) Super-inattentive. Pass

What can I say, it's Red Robin. Nothing really sticks out about it and not really too much to hate on. The food is moderately priced and the mixed drinks are pretty good. I think the only real appeal to bring people in is the endless fries. Nothing really sticks out and wows me but I've never had bad service which is why I gave it a three star.

Soup came with meal instead if first. Pet peeve of mine.  Had film on it. No sharp knives. Beef on prime rib sandwich was very fatty.   Overall food quality was sub par.  This quality of the food and the service left much to be desired.  I will be back in hope that this was a one time occurrence.  This is not the best Red Robbin but it has never been this bad.

Went to dinner for my son's birthday.  No waiting for a table, service was wonderful and we had a very good and friendly waitress.  The food came fast; no mistakes and we never had to ask for a soda or coffee refill.  Even the manager stopped by to see how everything was.  My daughter loves the ribs and mac plate.  I love their avocado-cobb salad.  I would recommend this Red Robin and would definitely return.

Went here after an award ceremony for my son. He picked it 'cuz he thought all his bros would be coming here too. OK I'm game. I've never been to this location and have only been to RR 's a couple of times in the past so I wasn't sure what to expect. As soon as we walked in we were greeted by a cheerful hostess who got us (8 ppl) seated quick. Once seated our waitress was quick to take our drink orders and on her return made a few suggestions and took our appetizer order.  Appetizer Got some kind of triple french fry deal that had steak cut fries, sweet potato fries and onion strings with 4 dipping sauces. Ranch, sweet chili, bacon aoili & chili aoili. Not bad but the sauces didn't work out so well with the onion strings or SP fries. Burgers & Stuff I ordered the buffalo bleu burger W/fries off the special menu (6.99) cooked med. Cooked just right, juicy and tasty 3.75 star. Others had.... Fish n chips ...so-so fish (cod?) crispy, steak fries Mac n cheese.... very cheesy very good Mac n Rib-let combo ......small rib-lets had nice sauce, nice combo Jr cheese pizza .... 6yo liked it Soup n Sammy ......  clam chowder was OK, turkey sammy OK A1 peppercorn burger cooked med W/fries... very good Whiskey River Burger cooked med W/fries... very good Over all decent meal for a quick dinner celebration. Nuthin' fancy. Priced OK. Clean restaurant + got to watch the end of the hockey and B-ball playoff games. Nice family place.

my boyfriend and i love red robin tried many of their burgers and salads and sandwiches and soup love freckled lemonade definitely sign up for their new red robin royalty because you get free food! we go here all the time one of our favorite restaurants staff is always friendly  i was even upset one time for a phone to go order and didnt expect anything just wanted them to know what happened and they took care of my meal they really care about their customers and thats why i always come back never had a bad experience at any red robin

This is for sure my favorite Red Robin.  It's in kind of an industrial part of town, so you don't get swamped with screaming kids, or tourists.  The staff is always ready to help, and they actually listen.  I guess I'm a picky eater, because most places mess at least one thing up.  But not this place.  They're 10/10.  Only reason I can't give them 5 stars is the noise.  I can get pretty loud in there when the place is full.

I came here for dinner late. The bartender is very good and attentive to the  customer, but them playing around in the restaurant is unprofessional and I would not come back because of the horse play.  I ordered a blue ribbon burger and I ordered it medium rare it came out well done and the fried onions on the burger were old because they were soggy and chewy. The steak fries were good. Not worth a second chance.

Red Robin...Hmmmmm. They know where their bread is buttered, that's for sure. Red Robin serves up tantalizing beverages for all ages-- the food is secondary. Know that going in and you're golden. At least it all looks good, like everything else here. Their menu boasts a whole lotta burgers--you'd think that's what they do best, right? That's what I assumed when I ordered the Sauteed 'Shroom, but..I caught myself thinking that Carl's Jr.'s Six Dollar Burger was much better. Not that this one was bad, but just not good enough to brag about at the top of a menu. I ordered it medium and it came cooked thoroughly, not to mention that the size of the patty was disappointing for the ten dollar price tag. Meh. Onion rings -- the breading is very thick and stiff, the better to stack into the cool tower shape. Flavor and freshness just so-so. My sweetie had the prime rib dip, my sister had the chicken wrap, the kids had spaghetti and the Arctic Cod Fish & Chips. Nobody complained, everybody ate their food -- that's about the best that could be said here, except for the fish n chips--now that was a GREAT fish n chips! I think that's what should be at the top of their menu in place of those burgers.  The one thing that was universally loved at Red Robin were the drinks. The Strawberry "freckled" lemonade was delicious and gorgeously presented. My sister tried a custom-blended herbal lemonade drink which I would order again for myself next time, and the man of the table went with the Salted Caramel shake. Oh baby, I could feast on that shake it was so rich and wonderful! Applebee's, TFIF's, Chili's, Red Robin...six of one, half a dozen of the other. Service was very good, and thank you Red Robin for not requiring "flair".

I didn't really have much high expectations for this place since I've been to so many burger spots that they all start to just taste the same. Tuesday was my first time ever eating at Red Robin and I found their food rather average as a whole. I ordered their simply grilled chicken sandwich which came with a side of (unlimited) steak fries. As a drink, I ordered their peach tea super sweetened (I shouldn't have gotten super sweetened because it tasted so strong.. so my fault here lol). The chicken sandwich was fairly good though. The meat and buns were just the right size. That and the fries I originally got with them really filled me up so I didn't have space in my tummy for more fries. But no worries there... I didn't like the fries all that much. Some of the fries I got were quite crisp, which I love! And there were some where it was crisp at the ends, but very soggy and weird at the middle portion of the fries. It was really strange, and I cannot stand eating soggy-feeling fries especially when they're thick like steak fries are. As far as service itself goes though, I give it a thumbs up. Our waiter was very friendly  and attentive. My friend hates it when nobody comes by to refill your glasses without having to ask them, and this guy came around every 10 minutes or so to check up on us to see how we're doing. But ya... it's not a place I'd go to again I suppose. I was warned that Red Robin is often a hit-or-miss type of place though, so I guess this was somewhat a "miss" for me this first time around?

I went here with my military comrades and ordered the Whiskey BBQ sandwich which was alright however the place seemed slightly understaffed which probably slowed down service. That being said the waitress was friendly and got us our food and bill! Not bad! however not the best.
Great food and service and it was for our office outing for a birthday lunch. Had 15 employees and food still came quickly and was really good. Chicken Pesto sandwich is to die for

Ok, I don't get this petite burger thingy that they are doing here now.......isn't it the same patty they are servin up at Micky D's but  $4 bucks more in cost! I will stick with the regular big mammoth burgers that they usually serve....even if I can only eat about half!  At least I feel like I am getting my moneys worth.

This restaurant is hit or miss in my book.  The riblets...ehhhh  I've had better.  Some of the burgers and the Cobb salads are  very good.  Sweet Potatoes frys with sweet and sour ketchup are Delicious.  Good drinks and malts too.  Service is hit or miss also.  So over-all score is  a thr

Had dinner with my wife and boys'. And a very good experience, our waitress was very pleasant, and the manager came to our table and asked if everything was going good and if we needed anything. This has been the best experience I've ever had at a restaurant -so far. Very hospitable and a nice warm feeling just being there. Sucks I can't remember the peoples name, but I'm sure we will be eating there again. Cheers
Nothing special here. Classic hamburger place with low quality meat. Fun atmosphere though On a Friday and the servers are always friendly. The wraps are actually pretty tasty though.

Ridiculous! Went to sit in the bar area that had 3 tables wide open, we were told by the bartender that we had to be places on the waiting list behind those who want a full meal. We just wanted a cocktail... We just walked out because approx a month ago we went there with another couple, went to a table in the bar area, sat down at the corner large both and was asked to move because there "regular" was coming soon ( a family who likes to sit at that table, sure enough about 15 minutes later they arrived and was seated at that table.) Absolute nonsense at this location.

I am shocked to be writing a 4 star review for Red Robin, but boy did they earn it. I thought we would be going in for a loud, mediocre dinner....I was so so wrong. We walk in with our party of four and our waiter runs to our side, "Happy Hour ends in 5 minutes! Here is the menu for it, I'll be right back in case you want anything!" I looked around for a second...am I in the bar? Nope. Happy Hour is from 3-6 and it covers the dining room. Excellent.  When he came back, just as promised, we ordered the Hummus plate for $5. I was expecting a few pita chips and a small cup of sub-par hummus. What did I get? A large plate filled with fresh carrots, zucchini, cucumber, jicama and fluffy pita bread. mmmmm mmmmmmm. Another shocker for me was the kids menu, there was so much variety that my children were actually perplexed as to what to order. Thumbs up! My husband ordered the turkey burger with avocado and a caesar salad. He was actually laughing about how good it was. Of course, I ruined our family's healthy rep and ordered a beer, fish & chips (it was fantastic), but I don't care. What the heck is this? Where am I? Is this one of those hidden camera shows? We had a delicious, fresh, good-for-us meal at RED ROBIN?! Whatever, I'm coming back. Our total for all of this goodness was $48. Not bad for a family of four, drinks, apps and dinner. Our waiter was great, he was on top of everything and didn't miss a beat. Good job Red Robin!

There's nothing special at Red Robins, just classic burger. For fries, you have choice of either regular fries or garlic fries, they're both good. Had the Burnin' Love Burger, if was good, but nothing too special. Thought the food was a bit overpriced.

Went here with the broham.  Was always a fan of the food since he started to work there.  Doesn't work there anymore at the South Coast location but maaaaaaan he played a cool ass Red Robin!  Mofo had skinny legs and shit and liked to fuck around with people since they couldn't see my bro's face.  Up until upper management caught on and let him not have his fun.  Fuk em!  Ohhhh yeah back to this shit.  Yeah well the foods good too and all that.

They got my order wrong. When I got my fries there was hair in them. They refilled my coke with diet coke. My glass was waiting to be filled for 5 minutes. It took flagging the manager down to get the drink fixed. He offered no compensation. Not even an apology. With all the negatives I have to say the food was really good. I just wish the experience was better.
Enjoyed This Place! 1st Timmer @ Red Robin Nice and Clean Atmosphere and The Service was good

My review will strictly be on what I've ordered: Onion Rings - Super crispy, that kind of crispy that tears up the roof of your mouth if you eat too many.  Onions are sweet and I believe they use a panko crust for these little rings. Mozzarella Sticks - Standard and pretty much what you would expect from mozzarella sticks.  Fried from frozen, just how they should be. Chicken Tenders - These are standard as well. Royal Robin Burger - They always manage to mess up the fried egg because it is always cooked over-hard.  I don't know about you, but when there is egg in my burger I want the yolk to burst when I bite into it and ooze down the burger... food porn? This is a standard cheeseburger with a fried egg.  If you have never had a fried egg in your burger, it is time you start venturing out to new ideas. Burnin' Love Burger - I wanted to LOVE this burger, but I just liked it.  I am a huge fan of spicy and this was just about medium.  I felt like I kept wanting more of the jalapeno flavor, but with each bite it got muddled in between all the other components. Sauteed 'Shroom Burger - My favorite so far of their burger choices.  I am a mushroom fanatic and this hit the spot. Bruschetta Chicken Sandwich - I always order this with crispy chicken instead.  I have tried it as is, which is grilled chicken, and it just doesn't compare to the crispy chicken.  This sandwich is HUGE and will surely fill you up (especially after all those damn fries).  Pesto is good along with the balsamic mayo.   Caesar Wrap - Eh, I don't even know why I bothered getting this haha OVERALL:  I wouldn't classify these as "gourmet" burgers, but they are a tad better than most burger chains, given the variety they offer. Like I always say, YOU WON'T KNOW UNLESS YOU TRY IT FOR YOURSELF!
Service was wonderful, we were seated right away, our server was friendly, fast and attentive. Our burgers and appetizers were delicious!

Red Robin is a good place for large get togethers because there is something for everyone on the menu. There are healthy plates, burgers, chicken, seafood, and vegetarian dishes altogether. For a casual lunch, dinner, or a family meal, this Red Robin location is ideal. It's clean and right in the parking lot of the Costco in Cypress. I ordered the Whiskey River BBQ Burger and half of it was enough for me to feel full. We had a large party of 15 but the waiters were organized and gracious enough to continue filling our plates with the endless fries and were prompt in refilling our drinks. Our orders came out pretty quick and it seemed like they were well experienced in handling large groups of people.  The freckled lemonade is refreshing an delicious! I have yet to try the Wolverine Burger (yes, as in Wolverine of X Men),

This was my first time eating at this Red Robin.  I went with my friend and it was the last day to use my free birthday burger.  The host guy was friendly and he also took our drink order because I think the waitress was too busy.  It took a while to get our waters but we asked for a basket of fries to start and that was quick.  I got the new Berserker Burger that they have to promote the Wolverine movie.  It was really good... the aioli eally made it tasty.  I would get it again.  And of course those fries are to die for.

I hate to say this but the service here was terrible. We went on a Sunday afternoon for lunch and a couple of drinks. We wanted to catch the Dodger game and figured we'd get the best service sitting at the bar top, especially considering it was pretty slow and the bartender is directly in front of you should you need anything. If you came for the bottomless fries (something Red Robin restaurants offer with their food), forget about it. Our server/bartender never asked if we wanted more fries and when we did ask, she gave us literally about 15 fries for the two of us. Our server could have easily made a higher sale with us had she offered another drink but we never got that either. I'm sorry, but I'm big on customer service and when I saw similar reviews about the poor service here, I knew it wasn't just our imagination.

The Blue Ribbon burger is awesome! I don't get to dine here too often but a few times a year my wife or my friends and I will hit up Red Robin. The endless fries are very tasty and the seasoning salt really tastes good. Not what you would call a fine dining establishment but good food, good service and good prices, what else could you ask for?

Really only sit at the bar, but I have been really enjoying this location for quite some time now.  Usually have great food and service.  The drinks have almost always been amazing.  Only negative, recently they changed the way they wrap and present the food.  They used to wrap it in paper and put it in a basket, but now its on a plate with fries in this weird metal ring with them in center.  The fries arent as good now.  They are mushy from the heat from the ring.  Probably sitting in front of the heater before delivery.  Other than this bad change to their presentation, I think they are great!

Came In here last Friday. Ordered the double tavern cheeseburger w/ spinach artichoke dip. The spinach was ok. They were really shiest on how much they supply you with. I swear it's just a handful of chips too. But on the other hand the burger was absolutely perfect & hit the spot. So it kinda made me forget about it.

The good: A decent blue cheese burger with an herb encrusted bun   A tasty pumpkin pie shake with nutmeg sprinkled on top Unlimited French fries, although what was served with the order was plenty A wonderful waitress who told me that everything I ordered was her favorite thing on the menu (nice sucking up, or do I know how to order?) The bad: The poor acoustics that produce a deafening cacophony I don't mind this particular franchise so much except for the noise levels.  They have a dish called Ensenada Chicken that's relatively healthy and tasty.  Obviously I was in no frame of mind on this occasion to think of my body as a temple.  In any event, as far as the chain wars go, it doesn't completely suck if they could do something about the background noise.

The pros of this place is it's red robin so the food is the same as any other red robin. The parking is simple and easy to find, and convenient if you need to go to Costco. and the negative. Service is horrible. The hostess was rude, unattentive, and literally acted like we were a bother. I really wish I got her name. And then our waiter who was trying in the beginning. Ended up not being very attentive to our big party. I literally had to repeat my requests twice for almost everything.

Great burgers!! They really surprised me.  A few years ago, I stopped eating here because they had gone way down hill.  I think they are making a comeback and doing a fine job of it. My hubby and I stopped here for a quick bite on our way to watch the ponies run at Los Alamitos.  I ordered a Whiskey River BBQ burger and my hubby had a patty melt on marble rye.  We got to choose how well done we wanted our burgers and surprisingly, they were cooked perfectly!  Great flavor on my burger and my husband loved the marble rye on his patty melt.  The bottomless steak fries were a nice treat.  Hubby loves steak fries and not many places serve them anymore. It was getting busy at dinner time on a Saturday but our server never missed a beat.  We were in and out quickly, food was tasty and the prices were pretty reasonable.  Total bill $26 for two meals and two beverages. I'll go here again, for sure.
Red Robin has changed .. Why? The way my food came in a basket with a bunch of fries was awesome. Your a burger place not a fancy place. Give me a break!  Go back to serving just plain american food.

My family really enjoys Red Robin. The food is consistent and good, especially the burgers. The service is friendly, the managers are present and seem to be on top of things.  It's a great place to bring kids - loud and colorful. Both my husband and my son want to spend their birthdays here each year.

Oh Red Robin, you have proven yourself to be a difficult adversary indeed. While this review is being written under this franchise location, I must stress that this is a blanket review, one that covers all Red Robins. Consider this an open letter, oh bird of burgers. I suppose I should start at the beginning, though I cannot for the life of me reckon where the beginning is. I have been a patron of Red Robin for many years; as far back as I can remember the gourmet burgers and steak fries have been in my repertoire of culinary expeditions. Why, just up the street there used to be a franchise, though it suffered from an affliction which could not be observed, but for the symptoms, and the empty Saturday nights eventually devoured it whole, leaving only an empty shell with a sign that reads "For Lease". Now, Red Robins are a trek for me. They are not far, for in truth I have gone further for less; but it is still a strain upon my soul to venture through its doors into the din of an establishment forever ensnared in a state of limbo. For you see, when I was a child I could gaze on the decor and fare with an innocence, ignorant to the truth behind each flagrant splash of Americana. And the truth of Red Robin is not that it is in need of help, but that it must have attributed its success through the sale of its soul. Red Robin is soul less, and it reeks of a corporate world that believes putting on a mask is enough to convince us. Red Robin burgers are a foul deception from the devil himself. Each one a savory journey through distinct and well-made flavor; but each time, day after day, on one end of town or another, they taste the same. The burgers touted as gourmet may live up to that title in the eyes of some, but to me they are the Stepford wives of restaurant burgers: exactly what you wanted, but systematized to the point where there is not an ounce of human inspiration in it, and it might as well be made by an assembly line of machines. And every time I take a bite and enjoy it, a part of me is eaten alive. The steak fries also tell the tale of this Faustian kitchen, bottomless like the depths of emptiness found all around you as you sit and are engulfed in noise that drowns out any atmosphere. All the free fries in the world cannot and will not make up for their real price, the price we all pay when we agree to partake in the fruit. But the real tragedy in all of this is the people. Whenever I walk in and feel the chill rush through me, my bones aching with regret, I am afraid for the poor lost soul who will be my boatman on this proverbial River Styx, for their fate must be worse than mine. It varies from meeting to meeting: some come with their own packaged, bright-eyed cheer, which is either a facade to smother the torment inside, a willful ignorance, or a brave and concerted effort to bring light into their dismal existence; others have reached the acceptance stage of their journey, and their feet carry them as slowly as their minds, crawling along at a pace of a human weighed down by the solemnity of a broken reality. Our latest endeavor brought us to Tyler, his name only known to us due to our own skills of observation, spying his nametag worn like a badge of shame halfway down his shirt. We were greeted and served with diligence in what I can only describe as being acceptably efficient, though it was a forced and placid efficiency. He would not provide us with his name, nor acknowledge he was capable of any human emotion; his mind, it would seem, was a slate, onto which Red Robin had carved their own personality, devoid as it was of all compassion. Our server bore an uncanny resemblance of a fellow human being, but all besides the basic features and a commendable, yet futile desire to push forward in his work seemed to separate him from the robin itself, which stared straight past our eyes in an unsettling, harlequin grin. That is how it was, and how it will always be; as we sit and wait, ticking our lives away in the hopes of some humanity with our meals, we will be met with nothing but disappointment.  And the bottomless steak fries only delay the problem of filling the ever-present void that comes from entering this sour tomb where all that is good and pure sleeps restlessly. Are we but the machines? Fueling ourselves for another day of grinding down our minds and sharpening our claws for the next meal?  What do we deserve and what are we given, and where does the disconnect lie? Is it with expectation? Or do we have an inalienable right to soul? Maybe it would be different if all pretenses were dropped, if Red Robin could admit that what they do they do well: assemble food to be purchased and consumed, but nothing more. We have no right to deny them the right to try and do more, but their efforts are hollow and my time grows short. Maybe one night it will resonate that I am trapped in the snare of a monster parading as a man. One day we will all succumb, and heaven help us when we do.

We came here for lunch on a week day around 11:30 and the place had just started to get busy for lunch. This restaurant is in a shopping center with Costco so there is a lot of parking. We also came here with a two year old and they were very accommodating to her and provided a high chair. We even ordered a juice, but requested mostly water to be put in it and the waiter didn't charge us for it, as he understood that a two year old wouldn't be drinking much of it. The prices overall are pretty reasonable for good burgers. We ordered a Bleu Ribbon Burger and a Royal Red Robin Burger. The Bleu Ribbon Burger is a classic blue cheese burger. Lately when I've ordered these burgers the blue cheese is mild, but this one was a little more than mild, which I enjoyed! The Royal Red Robin Burger had a fried egg and bacon on top and it was awesome! The steak french fries were also golden brown, crunchy, and hot.  When we were on our way out I was in a food coma because it was so good and I ate it all!  I will definitely be returning here!

I brought my girlfriend here for her first time. It was great. We were seated promptly and our waiter came by quickly. I ordered the bleu cheese burger and she got the burger with the egg on it. She loved the bottomless fries and we ended up with 6 baskets between us =D. But when my gf tried my bleu cheese burger, her eyes lit up .. she awe inspired, going on about how it was life changing.  Non the less the service was great and the waiter was really quick and attentive. Would come back often.

Me and my girlfriend came here a few times already. I finally decided to write a review. We are always seated quickly here. It's like we choose the right time to come all the time, when its not that busy. At most, the place is less than half full. The servers are all nice, friendly, quick, and on top of their service. My girlfriend usually sticks with the wraps and I get the burgers. However, there was this one time when we both ordered a dish with avocado. She had a wrap with avocado add on and I got a burger with guacamole. Both of our dishes were missing the avocado portion. We alerted the manager who was walking around greeting people and she quickly solved the issue. Other than that, good food, good service, and bottomless fries with honey mustard!
Great food..took my nieces here when they spent the weekend. ..great place for food and conversation too. Not much of a wait at all. Servers were super...never waited for anything at all...
I avoid eating here whenever possible. I have walked out of this location on 2 separate occasions. Terrible customer service.

I had a takeout order during my lunch break. The wait staff was actually very nice, friendly and helpful. I ordered a turkey burger well done, dry bun no butter, and chipotle on side. I repeated each time the person said back my order. Took a little longer than expected but that was fine. When I got the burger, the staff read back my order and I said oh the chipotle on the side...and she said, oh let me ask the kitchen...uh oh, figured that meant it was on. Yup, doused with sauce and of course bun with butter even though I said no to that. And the burger was this weird compressed nasty meat. Why?! So weird! Oh well, as I said the staff was nice so maybe give them try with another item. Good luck!

Just no. Got a Bbq chicken wrap with avocado. Was it worth 11 bucks? NOPE.  The avocado was HARD. The chicken was scarce. The service SUCKED as empty as the place was. JUST NOPE. Oh ya u get like 6 fries. No wonder there are refills. If I ever feel a craving for RR for whatever reason...I'll definitely choose the Cerritos location over this one.
Besides my last visit the service sucks. Slow. And seem to not care. Food portions are small. Not sure why the basket of fries is smaller. Shall not come back here again.
Love this place and excellent service. Sign up for Red Royalty card and get free birthday burger!  I did

You can't go wrong with Red Robin, they serve what they serve and that is burgers.  They are similar to Islands but I would come here over Islands any day of the week.   The menu is quite simple and there are the bottomless fries!

Came here with my family and it was defentily a good restraunt to come  with family good customer service out server Ericka was good with us and go everything we needed and make sure we were doing fine cant find good customer service now in days like this :)

Service is hit and miss here.   Service last night was just horrible.   We were seated at table that was not property cleaned off so they hostess grabs a naptkin and wipes it as we were sitting.   Took quite some time for the waitress to come take our drink order so we ordered our food at the same time, we figured it would be a while before she came back.    Food did take a while to come out but it was good.   We were almost finished before she came back to check on us and brought 2 of us refills on drinks, the 3rd person didn't get a refill, he had to ask.  One person in our party asked for more broccoli and she hesitated and looked at him like how dare he ask for more.   Took forever for her to bring the broccoli but she did have time to chit chat  with another customer.  We did wait sometime to get our check, the manager must have known we were irritated by that point and would turn her head every time she walked by us. I think it may be quite some time if we do go back.

To start, if you like Red Robin, you like it. If you don't, you don't. There's really no selling Red Robin to someone who already knows what it is. It's just so boilerplate that wherever you go, it's going to be pretty standard fare (as far as Red Robin goes). So this is based on this locations merits. For one, there apparently was an incident right before my group got there. Firetrucks and cop cars... fortunately it had no effect on mine experience. It was packed! I didn't realize Red Robin was so damn popular. Fortunately, there was a underutilized outdoor patio right outside the bar that was open seating. So score one for this location!  Service was very friendly and attentive. Not one of the members of my party needed to ask for refills on fries, drinks, or water. They were ahead of the game. Our server was very easy to deal with when it came to splitting the check. So overall, I had a pretty positive experience at this Red Robin. I'm usually an easy sell because I love those garlic fries and all you can drink root beer floats! Cheers!

Tell me world, why do I insist on gettng the Blue Ribbon when I don't like blue cheese? Maybe I'm a closet masochist. Maybe I hope it'll grow on me.  Well guess what, it grew on me.  The Blue Ribbon is a delicious burger. Their fries are delicious with my overzealous seasoning. Ranch? Yes please. I'm a fatty, stop making fun of me.  Fairly quick service if you want to sit at the bar during work week lunch hours. Why doesn't this place get more stars you ask? Don't advertise unlimited fries if you aren't willing to give us as much as we ask. Yes, they bring fries out every time we ask, but if we have a group of 6 people don't bring one weak a$$ basket out. Then when we ask you for more, don't make us wait 5-10 minutes for another basket. The fries are the obvious selling point of Red Robin, don't mess it up.

Great place to stop off after 24hr fitness down the street. Bomb food cold drinks the only issue is the bar is very small and everyone can ease drop on your conversations other than that super friendly especially the bartender lyndsey.

If you like busy restaurants with slow service, booths with kids looking over your shoulder bothering you, then this is the place for you!  I went there on saturday and was very disappointed because I'm used to getting great service from the location in la mirada.  The only reason I came to this location is the la mirada location closed down.  I don't completely blame our server but the service was really slow and she never asked me if I wanted more fries before the rest of my burger was gone.  Usually a server will ask if you want more fries or refills on drinks but nope, came too slow.  By the time she came I just asked for the check.  Another thing is it's more catered for adults than kids.  Only two claw games were there to entertain the kids and they were both rigged so out of five dollars in quarters my daughter won nothing, rip off.

On Friday afternoon, I had lunch here. I had a gift card so I wanted to eat here before I went to the movies. I came in before it became really busy. The host was nice and sat us. The table was a bit small and cramped but I overlooked that. Our waiter gave us poor service. I forgot his name otherwise I'd mention him. He would wait long periods to check on us and we would frequently wonder where he was. The only good service we got was from a woman who was serving tables that came by and made sure we had everything we needed. I wish my tip went to her instead! Anyways, the food was good. I ordered the red tavern's burger and my friend ordered the Mac n cheese with riblets. I may or may not come back because good service is always a must.

Located near the Costco so there's plenty of parking. Was greeted and seated right away after we walked in. Free burger during your birthday month if you sign up with their Red Royalty Program! What we got: Arctic Cod Fish Burger ($11): fried fish with tartar sauce, shredded cabbage, pickles and tomato. It's your typical fish burger and I do enjoy fish burgers so I did enjoy this one. The only bad thing about it to me was that it kept falling apart. Fish was falling out and it was messy to eat...unless I'm just a messy eater...But definitely get it if you enjoy fish! Endless fries! They have many different dipping sauces too so take your pick! They seem to be pretty cheap when bringing out the fries...but hey it's endless so keep asking if you want more. Clam Chowder Bowl ($6): they totally forgot to bring this out to us, but whatever...we were full anyway, but it showed up on our bill. So then we just asked them to just pack it up so we could take it to-go. The container was already small itself and they filled it halfway?? Seriously?? After you forgot to give it to us, you decide to cheat us and give us a 'cup' serving instead of a 'bowl' serving?? Service: Our server was Kyle after we got seated. My friend and I sat there for quite awhile before he came to ask us if we wanted anything to drink or to start off with anything. Took awhile to bring us the drinks and to take our order. Everything was just really really slow. Kyle would come by and tell us he will refill our strawberry lemonade, but we wouldn't see him for like 10 minutes. Food took forever to come out, bill took forever to be given back to us. Won't be going back to this location anymore...
Great food. Plus beer equals funtimes. Had the red tavern double with sweet potatoe fries. Both were delicious. GO ANGELS! ANGELS 14  mets 2

Went here with my sis to grab our free birthday burgers to go. Hannah was working the to-go station and she was very nice and helpful in getting us extra fries, sauces, etc. Place was packed so the wait time was understandable. I got the whiskey river bbq burger. It was decent except that it could've used a bit more bbq sauce. Other than that I enjoyed it. I like this location better than the one at Cerritos mall since it's got more TV's around and they even have one on the floor. They also have some claw games for the kids that want a stuffed animal. I also noticed that they have changed their menu layout so it looks a whole lot nicer. I will definitely be back.

Typical Red Robin. The Royal is an excellent burger if you need a place that is "standard American fare" and something consistent across the country. I like that Red Robins also tend to have one or two local craft beers on draft, in addition to the "usual" ones. Service here was good; it was later at night, but the food was still fresh; the fries were awesome and the beer good.

Went to Red Robin on Friday 6/6/14 around 7:06pm and it was crowded as we expected.  Was told our wait would be 15 min unless we wanted to sit outside which we did.  Our server was Melissa who was pleasant and attentive to all we needed.  My wife had the Big Tavern Burger which she loved.  My daughter had the Tavern Double Burger which she raved about.  I, as usual, had the Artic Cod Fish and Chips.  This place is awesome.  Only complaint I have is the servers should ask at the time the bill is presented if a customer has a Red Robin Reward card.
Went here for lunch...pretty packed...waiter was nice...only issue was that our appetizer and main entree came out together....

Let's put the RED ROBIN out its misery!   RED rover, RED rover please don't send ROBIN over.  Ok this is NOT my first time on the merry-go-round and if my memory serves me right I used to enjoy this place which was why I went last night, but I suffer from CRS in y old age. After meeting a friend at PSSL (see review) we decided to go to dinner!  This place was on the way and I mistakenly made a change.  I knew I could get something simi-healthy by customizing so since D didn't give a hoot we found parking and went in.   This place has ample parking as it shares a lot with Costco's but it's located on the corner!  They get rather packed but I didn't think it would be too bad being that it was a Thursday night but I was as wrong as a $3 bill.  We were greeted as soon as we walked in and asked if everyone in our party was over 21.  When we said yes she said it was a 15 to 20 minute wait for a table but we could go into the bar and sit as a high table which was cool with us!  I guess this is a go to place for graduation dinners.  Go figure! She brought menus over and we started to look them over but couldn't think straight because the artic wind from the AC unit above us was freezing our brains and blasting FREEZIN COLD AC right on our table and us!  So when our server came over we asked if we could move and she didn't care! D quickly made a choice and went with the smoky, tangy bourbon-infused Whiskey River BBQ Sauce, crispy onion straws, cheddar, lettuce, tomatoes and mayo.  And he went with onion rings with ranch instead of French fries and a peach tea.  D seemed to enjoy his burger and onion rings but sadly I can't say the same. I had the Bleu Ribbon burger because I wanted something that had blue cheese on it and I remember that this burger had that.  They claim that it's "A highly prized burger", REALLY!  Can I see the score sheets on that one?  It was supposed to have tangy steak sauce, chipotle aioli, bleu cheese, tomatoes, lettuce and crispy onions straws and be the "envy of the state fair"!  I got it with a soy patty and a wheat bun and it came with French fries. I also got a peach and pom mixed iced tea.  The fries were good.  Nothing special but NOT dripping in grease which is a GOOD THING!  The burger was NOT what I ORDERED!  There was NO tangy steak sauce to be found or ANY blue cheese on it!  Bleu cheese is a pungent cheese NOT a mild cheese so I should have been able to taste it IF it were on my burger, which it wasn't!  They OVER DID IT with the chipotle aioli and my poor little taste buds almost got singed off!  Now I am a bit of a whimp when it comes to spicy stuff so this was a bit much for me and I have had chipotle before and did ok.   I ate the fries but ONLY half the burger and I was STARVING!  It's NEVER a GOOD sign if I can't finish my food!  I'm not sure where they are getting this,"...envy of the state fair", madness from but that is a bit of a REACH in the WORNG DIRECTION!  And STOP saying, "A highly prized burger", because I SERIOUSLY DOUBT THAT!   The ONLY thing I was envious about were the people that made different food and restaurant choices than I did.  It was a pretty DISAPOINTING meal to say the least and left me wondering why I stop coming here?  I do suffer from CRS (Can't remember s*it) but after my experience last night the memories came flooding back like a broken NOLA levee during Katrina!  NO BUENO! The ONLY thing that was GREAT was the service.  The tea and fries were just ok.  I can't say I'll be rushing back here any time in the near or distant future!  I think the RED ROBIN has flown the coop!  A $10 burger REALLY SHOULD be "The BOMB" and leave me WANTING MORE not running for the door!
Very bad experience host was a jerk. Acted very annoyed when I asked when would we be seated. Isn't that his job.

Okay, today I had another underwhelming visit here. I ordered a chicken dish with "Mexican spices" that came with a salad. Our server was pleasant but "cool," distant even. The food took a while but not what I would call a long time. When the food was brought to the table by a different team member (like many restaurants do these days) we started eating.  I could not cut the chicken breast with the dull butter knife they provided but no one ever came to check on how we were doing. I had asked for the Baja ranch dressing for the greens but they brought regular ranch. My bad for not catching that before the person left who had delivered our meals. Our server NEVER came back to see if our meal was good or if we needed anything...like a steak knife... Getting the check and change was also a bit...lame. My chicken was tough and getting our servers attention was almost impossible. Seems hit or miss unless A) You get a good server, and B) order a burger

Waited for 30 mins to get a table, customer service was descent, the wait for the food was an hour, and the food was the quality of fast food. From this point on, I'm never going to red robin again. It's a disgrace try even charge over 10 dollars for plates that taste horrible.

total hit or miss at this location. Be ready to be ignored by hosts, servers and managers.  Sometimes the food comes out as a group; sometimes I'm done before anyone else gets their food. Come if you're feeling lucky. Otherwise, opt for somewhere else.

Ive been to better Red Robins before.  Our waitress was okay.  She seemed a little annoyed when I asked for a couple different sauces and more fries... eh. She forgot to bring out the sauces my boyfriend asked for so I had to remind her.  Maybe thats what annoyed her but that's not my fault. The food was okay.  I came here craving their fries and salad and when I had it this past Thursday... It was just eh.  For some reason, it tasted alot better when I was in high school.  Thats how long it's been since I've eaten here. lol

Sad Birthday dinner for my daughter last night from start to finish!  We drove over to Cypress from East Long Beach for a fun, family-friendly dinner.  The restaurant was dark and gloomy and not too busy at around 7:00 PM on a summer night- hmmm?   I mentioned something about it being dark to the host, but it was ignored.  The messy blinds remained closed throughout the meal.  We were greeted by a server promptly, but our drinks took a long time. Someone else took several orders for her because "she was busy."  I like teamwork- great!  Our order was the first to be taken and our food the last to be served.  Three of four meals were served warm-ish and our fries and rings were cold.  If I am splurging on fried, it's got to be fresh.  Our server sent the manager.  Just for the record, my daughters chicken fingers looked like toddler food and both halves of my husbands wrap could be skewered with one sandwich pick.  My tri tip sandwich was average. The manager sent fresh fries and onion rings.  They were great, but now most tables around us had long finished and we wanted dessert for the bday girl.  They brought a sundae, but she was set on a shake.  After being served the first dessert, we reordered two kids shakes.  All of our empty plates and baskets had been stacked at the ordering end of our table and through all the ordering and reordering, not one dish was removed.  So many menus were at the other end, that we could not keep up with things falling over on our table!  It was laughable if we had more room to laugh.  Our server walked by at least 5 more times with hands empty and never attempted to bus our table.  A bus boy was never seen, but my husband noticed the manager was hanging out in the bar through our whole experience chatting away with "buddies." It doesn't even matter if they were his personal friends or friendly customers, he was not taking care of his business.  Okay, I just want to go home now, but the kids husband and kids have shakes.  I'm feeling like not much of this is the fault of our waitress.  I'm thinking she is new and has little backup.  The final straw?  The salted caramel shake tasted like the Pacific Ocean and ice cream.  I had to send it back.  Blech!  It's after 9PM and we talk all the way home about how we should have gone somewhere else.  $70 dinner that was way overpriced and for mediocre food, service, and overall experience.  I won't be going out of my way to go there again.
Just recieved my free birthday burger.  It was extremely delicious and was FREE. Over all I have always enjoyed Red Robin...their bottomless fries and burgers. Sign up to get yours!

I was floored by the service here, in a good way. I'm sorry that I didn't catch the waitress' name, but she was by far one of the better servers I have had in a long while. Friendly, smiling, accommodating... I could go on. I was with a group of 6, 3 of which were very young children but she did a fantastic job making the experience as enjoyable for the kiddos as much as the kids.  Aside from the great service, food wasn't bad and I haven't had Red Robin in years. The garlic fries are good (and they had no problem continually bringing out fresh fries for our table). The burgers did seem more on the fast food quality side than a sit down nice restaurant burger but hey, it was still decent. I washed this all down with their classic freckled strawberry lemonade... this was a nice treat after a long day running after all these kids! Without going into too much detail- I am grateful the bathroom was pretty clean, lol.

So, my wife and I go into the RR in cypress...we order a BBQ Chicken Burger and what we got would cause embarrassment to the Red Robin himself!  Imagine this....a chicken breast that someone took and pounded it out so thin that it was less than 1/4" thick, but the bun was too big to cover all of the chicken.  I'm sorry but Red Robin is going to hell in a hand basket.  I'll post a pic of it shortly.

This is an ok place to go and grab a burger. I just had a plan burger it was good. The service was ok but they were short handed some tables were empty and still had the plates from the previous people. The fries were GROSS it tasted like it was old.

My family ate here tonight. I ordered the cod burger with sweet potato fries. Inside my burger was a slice of hard core of cabbage and the cod fish is blunt, the fries is saggy:-( Server was not that good either, she was training one employee with her in training. Total..$85 is not worth to spend here.

I ordered a veggie burger & they tried to give me a turkey burger. Being a vegetarian for 20 years that was really disgusting!! I sent it back & the manger brought me a second turkey burger. I asked her if it was veggie and she said yes!! Please double check your burgers & beware if you are vegetarian.

Ordered boneless wings. Arrived cold like the corpses on Walking Dead. Sent back to receive 5 warm boneless wings the size of McDonald's nuggets we're paying $5 for. Requested a side of garlic aioli with my bacon burger. It came out as white as the napkins with a flavor no more than simple mayo. The bacon was undercooked like Carl's Jr and rubbery as well as thin. The only reason why this review didn't get one star is that the burger was warm (not hot) and the bottomless fries were hot and fresh. It's a shame the excellent wait staff has to put up with terrible products and horrible cook staff. What once was a place to look forward to is not a place I fear for what they will inevitably let me down for. Again.

We just ate there on 10/21/2014. Service was good. Food was bad. Uneven portions. Food had no taste. They have problems in the kitchen because everything was lousy. We had 3 burgers and a BLTA sandwich. I have 2 teen age boys and they eat everything. They did not even finish their food because it just tasted blah. We feed it to the dog. He liked it.  We are not mad at them they had good service just bad food.
Kristina was our server and she was the best, paid us allot of attention, very friendly, the food was great. We will go back again and ask fur her every time!
Awful service no silverware, food was Mediocre service was slow. I had to ask for napkins then ask for silverware again. Not the best time

So I trued this place out and I must say it was great! Our server Julie was the best. She was very attentive and very fast. Also the food was delicious.  So if you want to sit down and enjoy a good burger come here!!
Joy is the best waitress ever! Anybody who can serve a party of 23 people single handedly is alright in my book!

RR was packed tonight for Veteran's day. I stopped by thinking I can get seated at the bar, get in, and get out. The bartender (Lindsey) told me that they usually do self-seating at the bar, but since today was a special occasion, I would have to wait like everyone else. Fair enough. I put my name on the list and wait it out. I wasn't even mad that they didn't take party size into account. It seemed like the guy at the front (Carlos) was just blindly going down the list. They were pretty busy. I get it. The part that upset me was that after an hour of waiting, a woman comes in, heads to the front of the line, and asks to sit at the bar.  I see Carlos point to the bar and tell her "Yeah. Go ahead. It's open seating" I noticed she was not on the list since Carlos did not cross any names off (not to mention I saw her come in from the parking lot.) I went up and asked him if I could sit at the bar too. I was alone and had been waiting an hour. He says there are no more seats. I asked about the seat he just gave away. He mumbled a few words and said again, "there's no seats." Another 20 minutes go by and he calls my name to seat me. He apologizes for the long wait. If he would have stopped talking at that point, everything would have been fine. Unfortunately, things went downhill from there. I explained that the reason I was upset was that the bartender told me I could not sit at the bar without being seated there by the staff. I waited over an hour, and watched someone take the seat that I was watching. I suggested that he communicate with his staff so that they are on the same page. I also told him that I saw him seat someone who was not on the list. He got confrontational and snapped back at me, "Who did I seat? Tell me who." I don't know what this guy's deal is. Disrespecting a Veteran on Veteran's day? Unacceptable!!! I won't be coming back to this location anytime soon.

My experiences at this Red Robin have been mixed. Sometimes the food and fries are delicious and the service is excellent and sometimes the food and service are lacking. Once someone dropped off the wrong food and it took 10min to get someone's attention to correct the mistake. It's still one of my friends favorite places to meet up as it's a good middle meeting area for us.  There is plenty of parking as it share a parking area with Costco. My only annoyance with the parking is if you don't get one of the closer spots you're crossing busy enterance/exit traffic, which is not fun to do with small children.

Haven't been here in a few years and well.... Things have changed. The burgers are smaller the fries are fewer, albeit bottomless. I remember the burgers tasting a bit better. The changed the way garlic fries are done. The fries don't have actual garlic on them anymore. We aske about it and the waiter said the could make it the "old" way and out came these grease soaked fries sitting in puddle of oil!  It will be a very long time before I go back again.

The SKY HIGH BURGER was ****ing AMAZING! Definitely served to perfection. I was a bit skeptical about the goat cheese but once i tasted the fusion of the siracha type sauce mixed with the onion rings, bacon, and the overall juiciness of the patty, it just became heaven in my mouth. MUST TRY!

Love the all you can eat fries. You can ask for some to be brought out early too as your appetizer.  Lunch time is great and not to many people but tonight, with the holiday shoppers, it was slammed and short staffed. Get the rewards card for a free birthday around your actual birthday. Also after so many burgers you get a free one. Check calories though as some of the chicken items are more calories than burgers.
No star!! horrible service!!! no refills and it's not even busy!!! 20mins of wait jst for refills and they even forgot some drinks SMFH

We came here for dinner with friends. It started out bad we had to wait over 30 mins. The girl at the counter took our friends name down wrong. Once the manager was notified she got us a table and we were seated ready to eat. I was surprised that the service was so good as they were extremely busy! This is my second time here and I really like it!

Ate here the other day, and while no one really expects anything amazing to come from Red Robins this is probably the worst Red Robin in existence. rude service it took 15 minutes just to get my drink, then they bring my appetizer after my meal which was the wrong order. Then my wife's burger was not cooked properly as it was still cold in the center. dirty plates and utensils and food tasted terrible. Will never go back to that turd.
Endless fries, good garlic fries. Fish and chips was good. Went there with a bunch of guys and the blue cheese burger was also good. Looking forward for more.

Service was horrible! We waited at the hostess stand - there was an employee who was handling phone orders and didn't even acknowledge us. Then my daughters burger arrived with no cheese as ordered - it took 10 min to come back to our table and she says that "In-N-Out tastes better". The hostess had to refill my sons drink. Service was horrible! We definitely won't be dining here again.

No matter how many gourmet burgers I consume in a lifetime, I'll always have an infatuation for Red Robin's peppercorn burger.  For $11, you'll receive an average sized bunwich that's composed of hardwood smoked bacon, melted pepper jack cheese, tomatoes, crispy onion straws and A1 peppercorn spread generously on two fluffy onion buns.  The combination of said ingredients exude a smoky, sweet, salty taste that grabs hold of my affection to this day.  It also comes with BOTTOMLESS steak fries that are consistently fried well! Sprinkle the red robin seasoning on them and its dangerously addicting, rounding out the meal perfectly.  ----- Conclusion: There's an overwhelming amount of disapproval for Red Robin--perhaps because they're bundled with the fast food restaurants of the world.  You can't expect them to be on parr with 25 degrees or Slater's just because they claim to make gourmet burgers, but instead appreciate what they are, which is a family oriented restaurant projecting fun-flavored food.  The service is always fantastic, the menu is filled with options, and even provides well drinks and beer.  A solid 4 stars for me. Extra Notes: -Accepts credit card -Sign up for their birthday list online and receive a free burger on your birthday! -Decor is tacky, but in an amusing, care-free way -Bottomless fries! Make sure to get those delicious onion rings too! -Friendly service -Parking is never a problem -Clean restrooms

I always love to eat at red robin been eating there since I was little so when I saw that there was a red robin a few blocks away from where my hotel is I had to go and it didn't disappoint the service was great the lady who served my table was very helpful and went out of her way to help me which is a good thing because you don't often get that ar most restaurants she made sure I got my milk shake I ordered right after my meal as I requested it was a good thing and I was sure to tip her as she earned it. As for the food it was delicious no complaints and it's always a good thing to get the unlimited fries did I mention they were fresh and really crispy and delicious other then that I have no complaints and the next time I come out to Anaheim for a visit I am going to make another stop at this red robin location.

Went to the restaurant last Thursday evening I ordered a turkey burger w/ sweet potato fries. When my food arrived my burger was very good but my fries were not hot. I ordered more before they were gone  but they took so long to replenish my sweet potato fries & regular fries-our burgers were lukewarm when they finally arrived. I spoke to a friend who goes to another location & she said they are that way there too--on a regular basis!! What a shame to ruin a great meal experience.

Standard chain. Guacamole Bacon Burger.  For those that love guac and bacon and burgers, do I really need to explain anymore? Service was meh.  Pretty absent for most of the meal.  Had to ask for refills.  I see u glance at the table, empty fries? maybe I'd like some more? I've discovered how restaurants encourage drink sales.  Serve atrocious water.  Tap water here had a super strong off-taste.  Not mineral taste.  Like sewage taste.  Lemons were to no avail.  Hot water was safe for some reason.  Boosting dat drink sale.

Really good Burgers. Stacked Onion Ring Tower was a big hit at our table, as well as the Purple lemonade  (they need to have an adult version of that!). I had a Red's Tavern Cheeseburger with bacon, but it was good. Fries were meh (can't expect too much excitement from bottomless fries unless you just love fries any way you can get them. Great atmosphere and very friendly servers in a well kept restaurant. (Event of the night: My 12 year old nephew won a iPod Shuffle with $1 on his first try at one of the games in the lobby!) Good place for a nice family meal.

Pretty decent burger for a chain restaurant.  The bottomless fries are da bomb.  Having said that, Southern California has so many Mom & Pop Hamburger shops that rock.  Most of them are clearly better that this place.  Nothing wrong with the place, but the hamburger options are so numerous around here, I may find myself rarely coming here.

It was my first time coming to this location. I had never seen it before. It's kind of in a really random spot. Usually they are surrounded by shops or other restaurants. The manager greeted my friend and I upon our arrival. He was very awkward and confused about what he was doing. From the looks of it, they were understaffed because the servers were all panicking and a lot of guests were complaining about waiting too long. Our server was attentive but didn't really have a personality. I ordered a cheeseburger that was very delicious. I got charged $1.50 to replace fries with mac and cheese. It was very dry and all in one clump so not very good. I ordered some strawberry vodka drink and it was alright. The bathrooms were very clean as well as the rest of the restaurant.

After leaving Shenandoah at the Arbor for making us rush to be there and then not serving us after 20 minutes, my fiance and I decide to drive down the street to Red Robin.  Red Robin saved the day!  I still got my birthday burger protein style (and they give you half heads of lettuce that actually make it possible to hold a protein style burger) with bottomless sweet potato fries, and we were served promptly, like they wanted our business, and with a smile!  Winner winner burger dinner!

I've been here twice recently and I will say the first time things went by okay...it wasn't that busy but still it felt like they were under staffed and our waitress looked like she was spread out all over the place. The 2nd time was just terrible. We waited an hour for our food and the waiter kept saying your food is on its way...finally I had enough of the B.S when I realized the people that came after is were getting their food before us! So I asked to speak to the manager and he apologized and explained that our ticket got lost in the kitchen and their was a huge misunderstanding. Needless to say I appreciated his honesty and the fact that he offered to handle the bill for us.

Horrid service. No utensils after 3 times asking. Waited far too long for drinks. Rubbery chicken in the salad which also was void of the focaccia bread as promised. Kids Mac n cheese came with broccoli in it (accidentally) and they did replace it with a clean one.  It wasn't crowded, so I'm not sure why it'd be that bad. Won't be back. EDITED TO ADD-received an email and an apology plus an electronic gift amount to use at another visit.

I like Red Robin, they have decent burgers.  This 1 star is not about the chain as a whole, it is just about the one in Cypress on Katella. I have been to this one probably 5 or 6 times, and I realized yesterday when we were there that the service sucks every single time we go to this on in particular.   Every Time I asked for something (which I'm not demanding, I was a server) it took forever, no one even greeted us for 10 minutes after we were seated..   I still tipped my server almost 30%..  The reason why, it wasn't her fault the service sucked, she had a billizion tables.

Wow the service at this place has really gone down. It took for ever to get our drink and our food. We are still here waiting for more fries. But I'm ready to walk out. The food is good but service needs to improve. Not coming back for a while.

Went here yesterday for dinner. Got the smoke burger with chili fries. Hubby got a burger with garlic fries. I ordered my burger well done (and asked specifically there be no pink) with bacon also well done, put on the side and the sauce be put on the side. When I got my plate, bacon was on the burger and no sauce was given (had to ask for it after the fact) I removed the bacon and cut into the burger and saw it was a little pink. I was super hungry so I decided just to eat around the pink. The more I cut into it and ate, the more pink there was. I ended up only being able to eat about half. My husbands burger was good, but the garlic fries were terrible. They now make them with a nasty tasting fake garlic salt instead of yummy real pieces of garlic and oil. Manager removed the items from our bill but I don't care about the money, would have much rather paid the bill and had a good dinner vs less money and the sub-par food we were served. Doubt we'll be back.
They need to bring back the garlic French fries the way they use to be. The fries now are dry and the garlic seasoning is gross.the rest of the food is awesome.

Just ate here with my family.... DO NOT EAT HERE! We walked up to our table there was food still in the center of the table from the previous customers and water rings left over from the glasses. I literally had to use sanitizer to clean our own table! Then our waiter took approx 10min to come to our table. My son ordered a kids hamburger and there was melted cheese on his plate!!!! He had a hamburger NOT a cheese burger!!! My veggie burger was under cooked....NEVER AGAIN GROSS!

It's been awhile since I've been here. I do like the remodeled they did. However the service was really slow tonight. It took too long for a server to come over and take our order for drinks, then he left without giving us a dinner menu. Another waitress handed us one. Then it took about 20 minutes to get our food. It was not that busy at the time. It will be a long time before I go back.
After all that work remodeling the bar is open late on Thursdays with people playing beer pong
So gross, just found a hair in my food, and the manager acts l Ike it's my fault that I'm grossed out by it, no wonder their all shutting down

The service was ridiculously fast. Went to catch up with an old friend and was expecting mediocre service between ordering/getting food so we'd have more time to talk. Especially on a Saturday night. We got our drinks/food super fast. And our refills just. As fast! I believe a lady manager/supervisor was walking around helping tables out. Our server was a guy named "Ellie."

The take out service is horrible took me 18 min to get answer and place order. Front desk is worse they have ignored me for 15in like take out is beneath them. Completely rude and ass backwards. Hopefully food is good.

let me start by saying i consider myself a "regular" and have never had a problem in the past. this time i went in with my 3 kids, 2 newborns in babyseats. they only had 1 carseat holder.  our waiter was prompt and took our drink and food order quickly. they served us quickly but when we were running low on drinks i could not get our waiters attention. i was about to walk into the food prep area to physically find him when he popped out.  i ordered the burnin love burger and from the description everything had jalepeno in it.  the burger, aioli spread, even the bun and it was supposed to have fried jalepeno rings inside. it came to the table with a big chili on top skewered through. it looked awesome. i got about halfway through it and cant really taste any jalepeno good burger nonetheless. not spicy at all. the description didnt match was i was eating. but i still enjoyed it. they need to do something with the giant chili on top, it was the only thing that was spicy but it needs to be roasted or something, it was basically raw. i plan on returning to red robin, i think this was an off night, i would still recommend it.

Even judging this by the already-low benchmark of comparing it only to other Red Robins, this is a very bad Red Robin. Incompetent and somewhat snarky waitress, uncomfortably crowded dining room, slow service, under-seasoned fries, burnt burgers, numerous mistakes in our order, and to top it all off, dirty bathrooms with no toilet paper. Maybe it was just an off night, but I would avoid this particular location if you have a hankering for Red Robin.

Let me start with saying I waited 15 minutes before I was seated at 9 p.m. and there was only two tables. Servers we're walking right by me and my family of 5 and did not want to seat us at a table very disappointing trust me I will never be coming back!!! Will i still pay for $70 for hamburgers yes I will.   will I be paying $70 and bad service no I won't. I never leave without giving my server this is a very rare occurrence but I cannot tip someone without good service how the tipping process works you get tip for outstanding service!!! It seems like all the employees there don't know. Shame on the managers that run this restaurant you need to have a team meeting and discuss customer service.

Food is overpriced for what you get and service is slooooooooow. Had to ask twice for a bottled beer. And it was 5:30 in the afternoon when I was there plus it was dead inside.  Food is expensive for what you get $10 on average for an average burger. Appetizers are way overpriced. Onion rings were $8. WTF Where's the fairness.  Servers were very nice and friendly. The décor is typical of a chain restaurant of this type with lots of "flair" think of the restaurant in the movie office space.  Pass on this place because of the prices. You can get the same experience down the road at a chilies.

This company is terrible! My mom and I both got really bad food poisoning from the hamburgers here on july3 which was my daughters birthday.   I have called several times to this location, the Cerritos location and someone named Aubrey in corporate that never responds back to my voice mails. Do NOT eat here or will get the shits and vomits for days. We both lost 6-7lbs that weekend and missed celebrating the holiday.
The BLTA croissant was pretty stingy on the turkey. There was only 2 very thin slices, and the first set of fries were cold.

Very poor service. It took forever to get our food. Our food portions were smaller after the remodel than before the restaurant was remodeled. We had to ask for drink refills. The remodeled dining area is strange with weird pictures on the ceiling.

Horrible service, this was not my first time here with a bad experience but it is my last. We waited over 15 minutes just to have our drink order placed about 40 minutes to get our food. Our waiter had the nerve to complain to us about how she had asked if we needed anything .... Yes, she did ask but we never got what we asked for. We had to flag a different girl down and ask again after about another 15 minutes. We asked to speak to a manager because we then also received the wrong check, they didn't even see apologetic about all the time we waited and all the mistakes instead the girl Josie proceeded to be defensive and run her mouth when al we wanted was to pay and get out of there. They need some type of customer service training. I didn't even want to give one star but I had to choose at least one

Service is always great. We come here often. My husband like the burgers here but I am short of hating them. I always just get the onions rings. Those are delicious. I opt out for soup and salad or sandwiches (which are great either). Too bad since this is a burger joint.

Went to red robin tonite... First time, bad experience ... Service wasn't friendly.  No napkins... And sweet potato fries were COLD.  LIKE THEY WERE STILL FROZEN!! Food was average.  Bad ambiance... Guess the commercials tricked me....Red Robin... Hmmmm. Not going back.

I am so mad that they change the salad menu but not only that the taste of chiken is so bad like bad oil that they have not change in a while. The service os not that great eather! This was the last time i went there.

I didn't even take a picture of my amazing meal, because it was too good to put down. I ordered the chicken teriyaki burger and it was extremely satisfying and delicious. Probably the best I've ever had. I even asked the waitress to thank the cook. It was exactly what I needed after a long day at work. My boyfriend had the bacon cheeseburger and bottomless fries, both of which were "great." He even had a second helping of the fries :) The whole meal, from the service to the food, was spot on. Will definitely be returning and becoming regulars of this location.

I had their limited time Genysis (Terminator) burger which has fried jalapenos, bacon avocado, tomatoes, shredded lettuce and a sweet and savory sauce, THE BEST BURGER that I've ever had!!! Second time having this burger. So much flavor and crunch, I want more! My date (husband) had their Nacho crunch burger and I had a bite, also yummy! We both got bottomless fries, he got regular and I got sweet potato fries. Mine was good, but could have been crunchier. We both shared their Mountain High Mud Pie which has chocolate ice cream with oreo cookies, fudge, whipp cream and a cherry on top, satisfied our sweet tooth. Service was ok, it was busy on a Fri night. We enjoy coming here for burgers.

We arrived on a Sunday afternoon around 3. It was not busy at all and no one else waiting, then we waited about 10 minutes for a table for 5. A group of four walked in and were sat right away. Finally got our table and waited another 25 minutes for our drinks. We basically had to ask who our server was because no one had helped us. Then the drink order came in wrong. Blah. We ordered, food was amazing. We got our food right away once I told a manager what was going on.  Again, food was amazing. I had a blue ribbon burger and my husband had a smokenpepper. Kids had mac and cheese and pizzas. The manager compensated us 25% off and a free desert. We won't be running back because of the slow service. The manager really tried to compensate as much as he could and kept asking us if we were ok last half of experience.  Let's just say this is not the first time this place has had sloooooooooow service. I don't know if the servers have too many stations?  But something is going downhill.

So let's start with why it's two stars and not one. The ONLY reason why is because we like Red Robin and we will eat there again(just a different location).  My mom was visiting from out of state and my birthday is this month so we figured we would get my free birthday burger. We arrived at around 5:30 on a Friday. We have a two year old and did not want to wait too long to be seated. Having several years of restaurant experience, I chose to arrive before the "main" dinner rush. We were promptly greeted and seated, but there were 5 waitresses hanging out at the hostess stand along with two hostesses. One of the waitresses complained about how slow it was and how she didn't understand why there were so many of them working. I spotted three managers, two of whom were running food and taking payments. The dining area was filled to about 70% of capacity, and I counted no less than 8 servers (plus two managers assisting) yet we had 5 different people come to our table. Our waitress took our order but we did not see her again until the very end. Different sever brought drinks, a third brought our food, a fourth refilled our drinks, and we had to ask the manager for our check when we were ready to leave. The burger ordered with a gluten free bun arrived on a regular bum and had to be sent back, the egg on the Royal Red burger was ordered over medium(which consists of a completely set egg white and partially set yolk) was underdone with the egg running everywhere. We had to ask for refills on drinks, ask to have the sauces brought out (which we had requested when we placed our food order), and we had to ask for the side of broccoli that was ordered to be brought out as it was forgotten. When we brought the general lack of care and haphazard delivery of service to one of the managers he could barely muster an apology and said something along the lines of "well you did get a free birthday burger" as if taking advantage of one of their promotions means we should expect to receive subpar service. Everyone has an off night, but a little empathy and a real apology would have added at least another star. I guess they're used to below average performance at this location. We'll still go to Red Robin, just another store.

Just ate there.   My guy used to eat there all the time.  He always loved it.  We ordered salads and the salads came, they were smaller than usual and still had no boiled eggs for any of them which I happen to like on my salads   They have a new table top order system and I pushed the play button for a game and it said 1.99.  Well I canceled because I didn't want to play that for money.   When the bill came the 1.99 was on the bill! And no game ever played.   Boyfriend said let it go but to me its the principle. Needless to say  we probably won't be going to that franchise in the near future.

I have been to this restaurant many times, always for a late lunch.  After a day of packing I decided to bring my friend/helper for fish and chips, my usual order.  This was around 3:30PM, well after the lunch rush and before the Friday dinner crowd.  The restaurant was not crowded by any stretch of the imagination. After being seated we waited a few minutes for the waiter - Riley - we ordered margaritas, and since we had been sitting for a while and already perused the menu, we were ready to order.  I ordered a kid's fish and chips (basically a half order) with a side of cole slaw, as did my friend, and a short stack of onion rings.  The drinks were brought by a server other than Riley, and then we got our onion rings, also by someone other than Riley. We waited about 30 minutes for our fish and chips and when it came out, again by a different server, we got the two pieces of fish and about two tablespoons of cole slaw (another story there - barely any dressing), no tarter sauce, no vinegar, no chips.  I explained to the gal that this wasn't what we had ordered she immediately got an attitude and actually said to us "Well don't look at me, it's not my fault."  Really?  I try to give females the benefit of the doubt, hormones and all, but she was just plain nasty.  She then disappeared to bring us a "side of fries."  15 minutes later we still hadn't received the fries, tartar sauce or vinegar, meanwhile the fish is sitting on our plates getting cooler and cooler.  Seriously?  This is a burger and fries place - how freakin' long should getting fries take?  Certainly not 15 minutes.   I finally flagged down Riley - who hadn't been back to our table - no new drinks, no "how's your meal" no nothing.  I again explained the situation and told him that while we were waiting for our fries, our fish was now lukewarm and we wanted a refry (fresh fish).  He also copped an attitude and took our plates back.  No, "Gosh, I'm sorry, let me fix that for you."
