And he STILL didn't ask if we'd like another drink.   And there goes another 20+ minutes out of my life I'll never get back....  I flag down the manager, explain the situation and he goes off to the kitchen.  A couple minutes later the manager brings out our food.  The only problem is they didn't replace the fish. And I know this because I had taken a bite off one of the fish pieces and got the same piece back, except this time one side was soggy and the fish was rubbery, which is what happens if something is microwaved or put under a heat lamp.  I'm waiting for Riley to come around, which he doesn't (I think he was avoiding us) until another party is seated next to us.  He doesn't even glance at us or ask if the food is OK, would you like another drink, zero, zip, nada coming out of the mouth of our "I'm Riley, I'll be taking care of you today."  Arrgggggg.   At this point I was beyond PO'd, my face is red and I look at my friend and she's steaming as well.  We got up, went to the front to settle up for the drinks and onion rings (I'm not going to run out on a bill for something I have imbibed or eaten) and are told to wait while they get the manager.  When the manager comes I tell him about the fish being the same pieces we had sent back, rubbery, not hot, soggy, etc.  I told him we were fed up with waiting, fed up with the servers' attitudes, fed up with having to wait and wait and wait, only to get the same lukewarm fish, fed up but not fed and we just wanted to settle our drink bill and get out.  He offered a couple of times to get us food to go which was very kind, but I wasn't about ready to wait another half hour.  He did give me a couple of cards good for appetizers, and insisted on taking care of our drinks.   I will be back because I love the RR fish and chips, and I'm hoping this was was just a bad day, but I absolutely will not sit in Riley's section and won't wait so long to leave if something like this happens again.  On a good note, the manager was great and I hope he chewed out a couple of people.   BTW, we ended up at California Fish Grill, which was great.
The worst meal ever. My salad was wrong, my burger was still frozen , my husbands burger was also cold and the manager couldn't careless. Never never again. ...

Didn't even eat here because after 45 minutes they couldn't seat our party. We were told when we arrived we could expect a 15 minute wait.  25 minutes later we were told the "smaller parties" in front of us would be seated first since there was "no way" to accommodate our two high chairs at those tables. I told Tara the hostess that the children could both sit in regular chairs then and she said that "wouldn't make a difference." From a practical aspect - then we were a party of 5 and a party of 4 wanting to sit at adjacent tables. And if the only reason they couldn't accommodate us was the highchairs how could that not make a difference?  After 35 minutes and 5 families of 4 or more later ... We asked the other much less rude hostess how much longer we could anticipate waiting. She stated they were waiting for a party to finish, apologized, and stated we would be seated any minute. We were just about to wait until Tara then immediately seated a party of 7 (we were 9 - remember with 2 being either high chairs or regular chairs which could be added to the end of tables). I explained to Tara that they had seated so many parties in front of us that they didn't need to "wait for a table to open up" we could have sat at one of them and that it wasn't okay to seat immediately a party of 7 when we had been waiting over 45 minutes and after 8 families, she actually RAISED her voice at me and snapped, "well they had less people then you" We left because I was shocked by her rudeness and my son asked me "Why did she have to be so mean?" Since 7 families all of at least 4 people were seated prior to us - it was clear they were isolating one specific table and waiting for that party to leave. When multiple spaces with two tables along side one another (which would have been fine) were turned over as we waited.  So when they could have easily accommodated us had they not put those guests ahead of us ... Tara didn't understand how to prioritize seating. I hope they offer their hostesses retraining, we've just moved to the area and would have enjoyed this as a place to have a family dinner but will not being returning.

Blatantly put: poor management. Took us 10 minutes for a hostess to even come out and greet us. For a restaurant that prides themselves on burgers, you think they'd be able to get 3 burgers out in less than 40 minutes.. Service was horrendously slow. Had to ask 3 different people before getting drink refills. AND bathrooms had trash all over the floors including in the stalls. So I say again: poor management.

Horrible. Where is the management?!?! My family visited this location on 9/28/15 for lunch, and the service was horrible. Hostess was unfriendly. We waited about 15 minutes to be seated. When we were seated the hostess saw that our ipad (apparently they utilize this instead of paying actual people to help with the service) was broken. She mummbled something under her breath and walked away. Waited about another 45 minutes for the waitress to acknowledge us at our table.  Waitress was over-worked, but still could have been more helpful and pleasant. Not our fault that your store has bad management.   So, we waited 15 minutes to be seated, 45 minutes to order, waited another 45 minutes for our food to arrive. When our food did arrived they did not bring my father's food until 15 minutes AFTER we received ours. Waitress only said that they didn't understand the order. It was Fish and Chips.  Normally when dining out you will see a manager walking around asking groups how their service was. Can you guess if one was at this location? Nope. Horrible, horrible, horrible. Won't be back.

Lunch crowd is tough.. They are under staffed all the time.. After a third visit of piss poor service , (not waitress or waiters fault) slow food return, cold food that was obviously not thawed appropriately and a manger that was condensing and about as helpful as hemorrhoid has lead me to not return to this particular Red Robin.

Its really sad that this location has gone so far down hill.  Its been a few months since we been to the Cypress location and it appears that they have done a complete makeover, staff included. From the appearance, its modernized.  From the staff experience, a total step backwards.  We had to wait just to be greeted at the door.  Well, if you count the 3 different people saying that someone will be with you in a moment a greeting, then I guess I stand corrected.  Food was not delivered correctly to our table, nor was it timely. Bathrooms were messy and smelled like urine. It wasn't the normal RR experience that I had become used to.  I don't think I will be back, and judging by the Yelp reviews, I'm not the only one.  If you are craving RR, I would keep driving to the next one. I recommend the District in Tustin. Better staff, which make it worth the drive.

Horrible service! Will not be going back. Waitress (Melissa) was pre-occupied and didn't give us her full attention. Started taking our order and we could tell that she had something else on her mind as she kept looking away then excused herself while taking our order. When she came back she was still not 100% with us. She asked us 3 different times if we wanted appetizers which we had previously told her no. My husband ordered a bacon cheeseburger and then she asked if he wanted cheese on his burger. Ummmmm........it's a bacon cheeseburger. I ordered sweet potato fries with mine and my daughter ordered the freckled fruit with hers. When our dinner was finally served they messed up on mine and my daughters by bringing us steak fries. When I told the person who delivered our dinners to us that it was wrong I could see our waitress standing by the computer listening and shaking her head and rolling her eyes that we said something. She wasn't very attentive and we had to flag her down just to refill our drinks. Very bad experience!!

Just walked out of the restaurant. Never did that before anywhere. The worst service EVER!!! My wife was standing at the podium & apparently 2 customers who are regulars got seated before us. My wife pointed out that she was ignored twice by 2 different hostesses. We found seats in the bar. It took awhile for the table to be cleaned. When the waitress came over we ordered drinks that never came. The 3 people seated next to us told our waitress that they had to leave to catch a game & couldn't wait any more. We finally said to ourselves that it was not worth the wait. We walked out. The waitress was buried in the bar but there were two people working the bar. Why couldn't they help? It was busy but the manager obviously did not staff appropriately. My wife is now sworn off going to any Red Robin. She said "why do they deserve our money?!!!"  We've eaten there many times & have a loyalty card but that's it for us. There are other places to get a good burger with better service. Adios Red Robin!!! *** Red Robin contacted me & sent me a $25 gift card. I give them credit for reaching out but not sure if we're going back***

I like their food but every time I come here the service is not very good. The crew is young and seem to be overwhelmed at times and forget to check back or bring you something you had asked for earlier. I have been to other locations and had excellent service so not saying the place is bad just the service needs to be improved.

Well I heard from a friend the newly renovated location was better than it had been in years so we decided after four months of avoiding it we would try it again. They did send me a $15 gift card after my spoiled catsup incident that I decided to activate it last night. The place was packed. We were seated quickly and we did sit for 8 minutes until a person walked up explained he wasn't our server but would get our drinks. We then sat for 6 more minutes. They have a new device in the table and I asked my BF if he thinks we are supposed to push the call waiter button.  Finally our server walked up and apologized for the wait and said she will take care of us from here on out.  I got the new johnsonville brawtworst and had some items on the side but and added grilled onions instead of raw and it was amazing. It's a temporary menu item but I hope they put it in the menu. My BF got a burger and the bottomless root beer float and he was happy. Our server check many times to make sure we were ok and made sure his float was full. All and all it was a huge difference from the past five plus times we have been. Those others were all bad but we will make it a point to come back and try it again. We paid using the new devise and that was nice not having to wait for a check. Thank you Red Robin for turning things around. The only thing I would improve is the initial greeting and drink order.     WARNING, UNLESS YOU WANT TO BE CHARGED FOR GAMING DO NOT PUSH ANY BUTTONS ON THE NEW TABLE PAD AT EACH TABLE TO PLAY GAMES.  WHEN WE SAT DOWN IT WAS DISPLAYING DESSERTS TO TAKE HOME THEN IT WAS SHOWING TRIVIA QUESTIONS. NO WHERE DID WE SEE OR HEAR A MESSAGE ABOUT PLAYING A TRIVA GAME YOU ARE CHARGED. IT MAY ONLY BE $1.99, ITS THE PRINCIPAL, WE PLAYED 4 GAMES THE LAST VISIT SO IM SURE WE WERE CHARGED THEN.  WE DON'T CARE WHAT OUR WAITRESS SAID ABOUT A MESSAGE WOULD HAVE ALERTED US ABOUT THE CHARGE SHE LAUGHED AND SAID SHE WISHED IT WAS BETTER SO PEOPLE KNEW AND WERNT UPSET WITH THE STAFF. IM SURE STAFF IS LOSING TIPS. WE DIDN'T PENALIZE HER BUT NOW WE KNOW NOT TO GO BACK.   6 TABLES AROUND US WERE USING THEM AND I BET MOST DID NOT KNOW ABOUT THE CHARGE, ITS A JOKE AND SCAM AND BTW IF YOU ARE USING A CREDIT CARD YOU HAVE TO PAY FEOM THAT SILLY THING.  RED ROBIN YOU SHOUD BE EMBARRASSED. In addition to that the fries are horrible again, maybe a money saver so no one wants the refills. The bratwurst was really good but beer cheese sauce was grainy, TG I had it put on the side. SUGGESTION THE HOSTESS SHOULD LET THE CUSTOMER KNOW WHEN SEATED THAT YOU CHARGE TO PLAY THE GAMES.

Stopped by today for a cool and refreshing beverage mixed with some chips and salsa/guacamole.  I have never had corn in my guacamole but it was not to bad...the staff there are always nice. ..next stop. ..Costco.  Now I just wonder if this review will be recommended. ..not happy with yelp at all.

We went here on Friday night October 16th and had an absolutely awful experience. When we arrived there was a somewhat small line and we we told it would be 10-15 minute wait. After watching several groups that came in after us being sat, we finally got a table after 50 minutes of sitting. We were sat by a really nice young lady and we were told our waitress would be right with us. When she finally (Josie W) arrived she seemed took our order. Our meal came out 20 minutes after ordering and we didn't have 2 of the ordered drinks yet, nor our appetizer we ordered. When I brought this to our waitresses attention she said " Oh, I didn't know you ordered appetizers, but do you want them or I can take it off your bill". ( if you don't remember me ordering them, then why would you have to take them off my bill?). Furthermore we were never asked if we wanted more "bottomless fries" and it was just an overall bad experience. We would be hard pressed to go back here no matter how much we liked it before Friday.

Great place to unwind and have a burger. The remodel of the restaurant looks great. Thanks to the guys in the bar they always take cary of us so we're able to enjoy a drink and our favorite burger. Thanks to the corporate office for taking care of us gluten free individuals so we are not left out.

Red Robin has excellent burgers. Their portions are just right. Endless fries and awesome onion rings really compliment the burgers. I usually stick with a traditional cheeseburger. I have never been disappointed.

I generally like Red Robins and most of their burgers taste pretty good. I have to say some of their wraps are pretty yummy, too. My favorite burger is banzai burger - their version of teriyaki/hawaiian burger. It's so moist, a little bit sweet - just a nice combination of all that goodness! That's what I enjoyed in my latest visit there! I am a fan of their steak fries, esp. when they come out really hot and crispy + sprinkle their seasoning! So yummy! I noticed that they now have garlic fries that you can substitute for $0.99 extra so I thought I'd give it a shot. It was actually a terrible idea! It was not good at all. They just sprinkle garlic powder over the regular fries, some pre-shredded Parmesan cheese, and sprinkle some parsley (I couldn't tell if they are dried parsley or fresh one :0) Nothing fancy and didn't really make it gourmet either. A little disappointed but that's ok, I'll just stick to what I like and what they do better - the regular steak fries.  BTW, if you join their burger club, you can get a free burger on your b-day month! Woohoo!

Positive: - Salad and burger tasted good. - Menu lists calories next to each item (or is that required by law?) - Free unlimited fries Negative:  - Tablet on the table is annoying, especially the bombardment of adverts. I felt sad watching kids zone out playing crappy Red Robin sponsored games.  - The quality of food is reminiscent of fast food, same old mass-produced frozen food reheated to serve the masses.  - Server was annoyingly happy and bouncy and replied "absolutely" to everything, including comments we made where the word "absolutely" makes no sense (reminds me of the waiter in the movie The Office). He also came to our table every 5 minutes and wouldn't give us time to eat our food - I had to reply that everything was okay with a mouth full of food.  - Free Unlimited Fries taste horrible (and we never got a refill, which was actually a good thing)

Just finished getting dinner here with my husband tonight and I was much more impressed by their service tonight than the past several times we've eaten here. Our server was Riley, and he was friendly and attentive.

Been here a few times, always when they are not super busy. All the servers we have had were great. They do make it easy with an electronic order at your table, your server just needs to get you started. The food is always hot and fresh, nothing negative to say. We will return, multiple times.

We decided to eat dinner at this location.  Very clean, nice and big but our server wasn't the best tonight.  She was to worried about restocking rather then making sure we had what we needed. She was sweet and nice but we had to bother other workers to get refills and get us what we needed.  I understand towards the end of your shift you just wanna restock and get out and go home but she had one final table to check on and she truly failed.  The food was great and and as a rewards member I love my perks. Just disappointed with tonight's service.

Food was delicious and the waitress was excellent, however, the hostess had a bad attitude, which really soured the evening.  Bad attitude = no repeat business in my point of view. The hostess is the first impression and the last impression of any business. Positive or negative, in this case negative.

My family and I like red robin but the night of 11-15-15, the service was really bad. The server took for ever to greet us and to bring our drinks. We finished our drinks and they were completely empty for about 15-20 min. and she never came back to refill them. My wife ended up getting sick and we had to take our food to go. So at least I couldn't see it get any worse.

The food was good. Love the burgers and fries. It was when it was time to pay. $85.44 gave the waitress 4 $20 dollar bills  one $5 dollar bill and $1 dollar bill. $10.99 was taken off for my birthday reward. She comes back with the bill saying that I still owed $7.75 I told her i gave you $86.00 she goes to her manager and says. She claim she gave me $80 bucks. If you didn't do anything wrong, then why are you apologizing.  I mean I could have made a big deal. But since we took my mother out for her birthday there I let it slide. I believe in Karma!!! Fool me once shame on you, fool me twice shame on me. Never again

The game console and payment system is pretty cool. We came to celebrate a family occasion and the restaurant was fairly crowded. Our server seemed new or extra busy, but gave it her best. My oldest ordered fish and chips which she didn't like and our server suggested the Tavern Double which she loved. The fries are always fresh and fantastic. I've always loved their French Onion soup and hubby orders the Whisky River BBQ burger every single time.

A really nice & clean red robin location.  They always have open seats available in the bar area which is really convenient for Monday night football viewing. The food is consistently good and bottomless fries are always nice.  The down side is they never have happy hour.  My husband and I always get the onion rings to start. I order the strawberry lemonade which is a bit pricey at $5 but with my 5 refills. .. usually worth it lol.  Burgers are pretty much the same across the board. Just different sauces and toppings.  Service at this location is always good. Servers are pretty on top of it with drink refills and such.

Red Robin food is usually pretty good. Tara, our server was pretty good. My wife is Gluten free. Macaroni was in her salad. Avocado in an avocado bacon burger is as hard to find as an honest crook. We asked for the manager, I can't give you the real managers name. He was in hiding. The mater Dee (sp)was sent instead.  Wow now my wife tells me there's no toilet paper in the ladies rest room. If you own stock, sell it! Fast. Tomorrow I may call corporate.

This red robin hits my worst list of all time. Long waits, bad service and horrid food. Burgers that were reheated, frys that were cold and salad made from very old lettuce. Upon confronting management we were received with a snear. I will never be back and my experience makes me think twice about going to any other red robin

Came back here to give it another shot and it was a much better experience. (I didn't get seated in the bar this time) so that might of helped. But our waitress, (I think Katie?) sorry, I forgot.. She was so nice, she checked on us frequently and we never even had to ask for refills. 4 stars only bc when u order more fries it takes like 15 minutes to get them. Other than that, no complaints.
They used to have good service and you could get in and out. Now you wait and wait for cold food. I don't think I will be back after two bad experiences in a row.

I was seated by a friendly hostess and my waitress asked if I would like anything to drink. I asked for a Diet Coke and bottomless fries. She returned with my order and took my meal order  but after that I never saw her again until my food was returned. ( I went on a Monday at 3pm and there were maybe 10 people in the restaurant) I had to walk up to the bar to get a refill on my drink and ask for more fries. When I needed another refill I was looking around for my waitress and saw all the employees just standing around with each other talking about their weekend. I asked for a refill and sat back down.  My food arrived and tastes like cardboard I asked for medium and it came back well done also My fries were cold. After finishing I sat at my table for about 15 before my waitress  walked up to me. I said I would like to pay and she pointed to some kiosk and said you pay with this like I was supposed to know. I asked for the manager but the service was so bad and he was like talking to a stoner he just said I'm sorry the food tastes so bad I'll talk to my cook. Overall it was a Terrible experience and I will never come back.
Got seated right away. Server was excellent. Food was delivered quickly and was hot. I was apprehensive after reading bad  reviews. Would definately eat here again.

I placed a to go order last night.  I got home and got halfway through my meal to find a long hair in my food.  I was disgusted and threw it away.  I will never visit here again.  Maybe they need to invest in hair nets and have the men cover their beards while they are cooking like Costco does.
Wait was about 10 minutes for dinner. The burgers was good but nothing special. Waitress was nice and friendly. Could be better at bringing out the endless fries.

The burgers are good. The order to go is fast. But the fries the don't give you is ridiculous. For paying for endless fries while getting a to go order you think they be generous. But I can seriously count my fries. 7 fries and that's it. Stop being cheap!!!!

I am tired of going to restaurants and having my food come to me wrong and my trip to this restaurant was no exception. Server Kristina F. could care less about our table. She rushed us through our order and was all too happy to ignore us most of our visit. When she did come by our table she would just drop stuff and rush away before we could ask for anything. We did ask to try a beer on tap because we were planning to order some drinks but she never returned with that and therefore we were stuck with the water we first ordered when we sat down because we never had the chance to order anything more after that.  When our food came to us it was wrong and missing ingredients which is probably the kitchens fault but I never got the chance to voice that it was wrong because she continued to ignore our table until we started to pay on the kiosk on the table.  This is the worst visit I have had to this restaurant. Get it together Red Robin.

Our server Christina was rude. Asked for more fries and she said "I suppose". We were there a bit before closing and she loudly said said "ha what a tip, I hope they don't come back" we would have tipped more of she was actually polite about doing her job.  definitely won't be coming back to this Red Robin. 2/6/16

Not my favorite Red Robin at all. I walked in with nobody there, and someone walked by three times without greeting me or saying I'll be with you in a minute. Food took forever to come, fries were not fresh and the waiter seemed less than happy to be there. So basically, I could've enjoyed the meal better if I made it at home. It's all about customer service.
The Royal Burger is the best taysting Burger.  Our server was great, except I didn't like being rushed and I didn't get a thank you when we left.

This is my go to red robin, and it never fails to disappoint. Never had a bad experience. I went in a few days ago though, and was greeted by the rudest host ever. His name was Jordan, I know this because I went to high school with him. He just acted as though he didn't even care about his job! It was annoying especially since I used to be a host, I know how to treat customers that come into a restaurant. This won't affect me from going to this red robin, but I just wish that they could hire people that seem to enjoy their job, like all the other employees I have interacted with.

Went last Saturday night around 5 OClock, wasn't busy at all. The hostess was nice & greeted us the moment we came in the door, we were then seated right away, the food was good, prices were decent, TVs had the game on.  All in all, it's a nice family spot.

Overall: 4/5 There's a lot to like about this location with their spacious parking, cool waiting area, friendly hostess, and delicious burgers. Unfortunately, our waitress seemed to be racing between her tables, dropping off food and drinks without even slowing down, which made it almost impossible to get her attention and definitely brought down an otherwise delightful meal. Service: 3/5 The service here was about average. I have been to other Red Robin restaurants and have had much better service than what I experienced at this particular location. The waitress was very friendly and pleasant, but seemed to be going at a 100mph the entire night....granted she seemed to be very busy, but when your waitress is dropping off food and drinks on her way to another table without even breaking stride or allowing you the chance to ask for something else, it kinda gives you a rushed feeling and makes your dinner a little unpleasant. Many time we were left waiting for her to make another sprint around her tables for us to have a chance to hopefully get her attention to ask for more drinks or fries...most of the time unsuccessfully. Aside from our waitress, the people delivering the food were very pleasant and helpful. The hostess was also very welcoming and friendly...she even rushed to open and hold the door open for my wife who was on crutches, which I thought was really sweet. Cleanliness: 5/5 The restaurant is very clean. I particularly liked the waiting area with the awesome "burger chairs" and the chalkboard to keep my 2yo entertained. Parking is a breeze since they share their massive parking lot with Costco. Food: 4/5 The food is pretty standard for a Red Robin except for the fact that my burger was a tad dry (not a big deal) but still delicious. If you haven't been to a Red Robin before their burgers are their signature (can't go wrong with my fav: the peppercorn burger) with all-you-can eat steak fries (regular or garlic Parmesan). I also enjoy the crispy onion ring tower. The kids menu is pretty great with some unique selections like the meatball lollipops (which my son loves) and chicken stickens (grilled chicken bites on sticks) to go along with the tried and true hamburger, pizza, corn dogs, Mac and cheese, etc...

Only because Yelp won't allow anything less than 1 star. First and last time here. We waited 10 minutes just to be seated for half an hour without a server. Flashed our light in the kiosk twice and no one ever showed up. Manager was making her rounds and never stopped at our table. Hostess got us drinks but never came back with my 2 yr old daughters apple juice. She cried as we were leaving because she loves Red Robin and was really looking forward to pizza and apples.

The burgers were the bomb! I don't remember Red Robin's burgers being this good. We had the Blue Cheese and Wedgie burgers. And they had a good selection for our 8 yr old. You have to order the garlic fries (Addicting)! and endless! Don't be surprised the first batch only has about 6 or 7 steak fries so order more right away. Cudos to our waitress Ashley who was great and very attentive. We will be back!

We've been to this red Robin before and have never been disappointed but tonight was an exception. Took awhile to get menus,  delivered the wrong soup & switched it right away but then we noticed the BLTA sandwich was missing the bacon as well, (and was very skimpy on the turkey), so we hit the button on our table computer to call our server & no one ever came, finally my husband finished his sandwich, I was already done, we explained the error & the manager offered us free desert and we declined as we were full and the result was, ok- 10% off your bill, sorry, we got busy. Not really a good response. Sorry. Won't be back here.
Ate and drank here tonight. Good times! here tonight. Brianna gave us great service. Nice manager Dan came by to check and we told him our food was great. Ice cold beer too!

As yelp says an "A-OK" burger spot in Cypress. They are known for their bottomless french fries (when you can grab your server to refill them) and the free birthday burger deal (you can sign up on their website).  I've had good and bad servers here. The good ones are always super prompt, make sure you have refills, and make sure that you have everything you need. The bad ones don't even check up on you and bring the check before you're even done with your meal. Regardless, I still come here on occasion when they come out with new burgers that sound good or if it's someone's birthday. Your safe bets when you go to red robin include the following: -the bleu ribbon burger - tangy steak sauce, chipotle aioli, bleu cheese, tomatoes, lettuce and crispy onion straws on an onion bun. -Sauteed mushroom burger - mushrooms sauteed with garlic and parmesan and melted swiss cheese -Tavern double - two patties, cheese, lettuce, tomato (there are other variations that are spicy and have bacon) I have found that their guacamole bacon burger usually doesn't come with enough guacamole on it to even have a detectable guacamole flavor. Additionally, their more expensive "finest" burgers are really messy, especially the black and blue burger, which I couldn't even pick up without it spilling everywhere. Their alcoholic drinks are generally good here and are on the stronger side. They are also cheaper, especially compared to other restaurants in the area. Their alcoholic milkshakes are really fun to pair with a burger, and they also have a variety of specialty non alcoholic drinks for kids as well.
Good food and service! Great menu selection. Need to try the desserts on my next visit.

This place made me stop going to red Robin.  It's a true shame because the other locations are decent.   The chefs here serve cold burgers.  Even I as a horrible cook,  know that, you take the buns off last.  That way,  the bread is hot when it is served to a guest.  The buns came out frigid cold.  I sent it back.  The burgers set you back at least $10. They should have the very basics down.   The server brings it back after a wait. And guess what?  It's still frickin cold.   Are you purposely insulting me chef?  Rather than complain, and allow the business to correct their mistake.  I took the insult as an insult, and swore off this chain.  You guys have lost me forever.  It is done.

Picked up Togo for lunch and got the $15 deal that came with 2 double tavern burgers with the buffalo wings, side of fresh and salad.  When I arrived to pick up the order, the bill came out to be $18.20.  I asked her why and she first explained that I have to pay a little more but I pointed out to her that their website clearly said 'pick any 2 Tavern burgers for$15'.  Then she said it is $15 but plus tax.  I explained to her that the sales tax is not 20%.  Then she is willing to check with her manager and corrected the bill. Food: the burgers and the buffalo wings were very good.   ****TIPS: CHECK YOUR BILL!!!!!!****

Visited this Red Robin for a quick lunch, and we had Francis as our server. She was really great and provided excellent customer service, got our food out fast, and brought us refills without asking. One of the best servers I've ever had, and she was very friendly and nice. Definitely will be coming back!

Started off not so great because I was not able to sit in the bar area with my wife and daughter.  Yes, my daughter is 16 and I know that under 21 people can not sit "at the bar" but I have been in a lot of restaurants and my daughter has always sat in the bar area to watch the sports that are on tv with my wife and myself.  That was very odd. Next, they put us at this special table that is "half-in" in the prep area so it was very noisy, and the drink machine is right next to the table.  It was very awkward.   I ordered a beer when we ordered the drinks and it took 10 minutes to get my beer when my wife and daughter got their drinks in about 3 minutes. After my wife got her water and when she ordered her food, she ordered a drink.  That took about 10 minutes to get. As far as the food, it was very good.  We all got different turkey burgers and they were all super delicious.  The barbecue caesar salad was good and we got both types of fries (sweet potato and regular) and they were good.   So all in all... a decent visit that could of been better.

The burgers are always on point but the fries? Soggy and stale. C'mon guys!!! My friend and I pointed it out to a waitress and she said the garlic fries are supposed to be soggy but for the regular fries she can order them more crispy. Um, the fries we had were ones that were made and left sitting out until someone orders more. It wasn't hot like it was just made at all. The waitress comes back with the new batch of fries and it was piping hot and perfect! Too bad we didn't feel like eating anymore though. I probably won't be back to this particular Red Robins.

I am never disappointed with the food at ANY Red Robin; but this one had something special there. Our server. My wife and I were craving burgers, so we stopped at the closest Red Robin we could find, on our way home. The wait was reasonably fast for being lunch hour. Shortly after sitting down, our server, FRANCIS, was on top of it. Within minutes we had drinks and a basket of hot fries to munch on, while our burgers were being made. Now my wife and I are big on customer service. Even though FRANCIS had other tables, she checked on us every few minutes, to make sure we we doing ok. It's because of FRANCIS' speed, courtesy, professionalism, and attention to detail, that we gave her a good tip. You EARNED it. Even though we live in the next county, we will drive to Red Robin-Cypress, just for FRANCIS' OUTSTANDING SERVICE.

The burgers were so awful at this place that, as we were eating our burgers, a Taco Bell commercial came on one of their tv's and my husband couldn't help but say, "That looks good." ...  The burgers are far from gourmet.  They had a funny taste to them and not one of us finished our burger.  There were no condiments on my burger and the ketchup bottle on the table was empty.  Really???   We came home and had to eat a snack to get the bad taste out of our mouths. The wait was 15 minutes on a Sunday afternoon.  We thought it would be pretty busy, but when we were seated we noticed that more than a few dozen tables were empty.  So, not sure why the long wait. The service was just so-so.   We go out a lot and I don't remember in our recent dining experiences service so bad.  The water served to our table tasted like dish soap. So, no beverage for me, thank you very much.  We were initially brought the wrong drinks (I only drink water and I was brought a 7UP.  Ew.) and my husband was brought the wrong burger.  The bottomless fries are not a thing here.  Only one serving and no offer on refills.  Our waitress refilled my husband's soda only having to call for her.  The best part of the trip was the humor in how awful it was. UPDATE:  Two weeks ago, after posting the above review, I received the following message: "Thanks for taking the time to share your review with us, we appreciate your feedback. It sounds like we missed the mark here and we'd like to follow up with you. Please send over your email address/phone number so we can connect directly. Thanks for the help! Jen K. Red Robin" I promptly sent my contact info, but didn't hear anything back.  After a couple of days, I replied with: "Hi Jen, I was disappointed not to hear back from you.  The reason we didn't complain during our visit was because we figured managment wouldn't care.  Perhaps you were off work for a few days.  I really wanted to give RR the chance to make this right.  I don't think I've given a "1 star" yelp review to any business as of yet, and it made me sad to do so. ..." On April 28th, I received:  "Hi L K., Thanks for sending over your information. Our guest relations team has received your feedback, and will get back to you within the next 7-10 days. We appreciate your feedback and want to make sure you receive the best guest experience. Thanks, Jen K.  Red Robin" Twelve days later, I have not received a reply... I guess our first instinct was right.  Management doesn't care if they "miss the mark" and they also don't care if "you recieve the best guest experience."  There are several other restaurants nearby.  I would advise you go elsewhere if you want decent service and an edible meal, ...

Poor wait staff with UNSANITARY bathroom habits.  Caution to those who eat and drink at the bar.  Came here with my family I think three Sunday's ago and my mom was in the bathroom and saw that the bartender (big tall white girl with purple hair) threw her apron on the bathroom floor of the stall while she was using the toilet.  Gross. Luckily we were sitting in the dining area but it was very unappetizing to think about and makes you wonder about the health practices here. I used to love Red Robin.  In fact it was my favorite restaurant when I was a kid.  I would always pick it for my birthday dinners.  For a time this corporate franchise was holding it down amongst the huge influx of trendy restaurants.  Im not frou frou, give me a solid burger and those endless steak fries with a side of ranch and I'm golden.  Not sure if it is just this location or if the quality and size of the burgers have gone down everywhere, but my once loved favorite Whiskey BBQ Burger has certainly diminished.   I came to this location once before and the wait staff was terrible but since I love Red Robin so much and this one is so close to my house I decided to give it another shot.  The second time was just as disappointing.  Our server was okay, not very attentive, and fake friendly.  We waited over 25min for our food, not good but not awful I guess.  The restaurant was not at all busy (surprise surprise).  I used to get some of the best service ever at Red Robin (obviously not this location).  I even remember telling a waiter that he was the best server I ever had!  What happen to those people?? Baby come back! Guess those days are over.  You can't say I didn't give it a second chance!  Red Robin, after a 20+ year love affair, I think we should see other people.  We had a good run.  It's you though. It's definitely you.

Love the BBQ chicken wrap and the strawberry lemonade. Service was great but the restaurant was packed so we chose to eat in the bar so we didn't have to wait, and it was like Arctic freezing. Everyone was complaining and the server said they could not turn down the air. Food and service were great walked out of there with frostbite. Ha ha

We usually love this place but tonight was the worst experience we had . First the hostess took us & then re route us to another table. She said our waiter Matthew will come to our table. As we waited for him a couple arrived , got seated. Matthew took their order before us. Finally he came & said  I will just take utensils & I will come take your order. Well he came after 2 minutes with no utensils or napkins at least. I wanted a root beer float & he said they didn't have it tonight. My son asked if we can have fries to start, he brought us a very cold sweet potatoes instead which we didn't want to eat. He brought our orders . They looked ok but my fish & chips was so oily, dark color like it was soaked in an old oil. I thought it was burned but worst it was so saggy barely cook, you touched it & it pulled apart. We have our food & still no utensils or napkins. I had to ask for   anyway I tried to wipe it with a napkin  & you can see the old oil they cooked from. He came back to check if we are deliciously enjoying our   I showed him my food. He decided to take it out from our bill & the manger came to apologized later but it already ruined my night. Nothing was right. My son's food was supposed to have guacamole but also forgot it. We usually put at least 15% of gratuity but service was so bad. It will probably a while till we go back here. I would like to support this place because I do live in town but this experienced was really annoying.

If I had to choose any gourmet burger from anywhere, it would have to be from here. I feel like I can't eat any "fancy" burger anywhere else but here. I would say that it's definitely my favorite burger joint. To add a plus to it, it's bottomless fries! Literally, bottomless! They have this special seasoning that I would just sprinkle all over the fries and it's amazing! Another food item that is a must is the onion rings. They have the best onion rings in my opinion! Red Robins doesn't just offer burgers, but they also have other sandwiches and wraps as well as entrée plates. Their alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks are fairly cheap and affordable; especially the alcohol. If I really want a nice sit down restaurant burger, this would be the place. Not to mention that I've never had a bad experience before; even with a huge party of 20 people during my birthday dinner here.

Bad service in an empty restaurant for 5:30 pm dinner. Prices are 10.99-14.99 for subpar hamburgers and the reorder of fries took 20 min to arrive and they were cold. Server spent 10 minutes trying to sell us on joining their members program, appetizers and up selling us our food order. Wish she spent that same time attention getting us hot food in a timely manner. Too many better options in the neighborhood to come back.

SO SO SO GOOD~~! They even have gluten free buns AND my favorite gf beer, Omission IPA... You have no idea how happy that made me:). I got some kind of avocado/guacamole burger with a side salad. Everything was amazing. I was surprised to be honest, but I definitely have a new favorite lunch place now. Thank you for thinking of us food sensitive people :)

Service sucks. Food sucks. The food took forever to come to our table and all we ordered were two burgers. The fries are soggy. The burgers are too greasy. Although it was not busy (it was basically dead inside), the service was incredibly slow and horrible. We asked for a refill for our fries and they forgot that we even asked for a refill. I will not come back ever again and do not recommend. 1/10 rating.

Now I don't do this often but I have to give them thumbs down. Anthony my server is a cool guy but a little in over his head. First, Manager Dan walks by my table twice asking everyone around my table how are they m, is everything okay skipped my table both times smh BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE DAN .Second, I come in an ask Anthony  to take my phone number to check if I have a Free burger he takes my number leaves comes back and says "YES"you do .
