So that's all done my thought it's a free burger oh well  I'm waiting on the check 20 min before anything or anyone says anything smh, now I'm just pissed and ready to go. Hands me a machine to pay on I put in my royalty reward number nothing happens, so I enter it again the same so I call a waiter over and she goes to check my bill and Anthony comes tells me SORRY but I read it wrong you don't have a free burger I'm sorry LOL Then tells me I will get my manage here comes DAN sorry Anthony read it wrong. Moral of the story .....people tell you anything you want to hear just to get by even at a restaurant

I LOVE this restaurant. I use to go here at least 4-5 times a month. The waiters are always patient and attentive. They check up on you just on time. Never have to call a waiter for anything. The food is always delicious!!

My fiancé and I came in around 10 PM on a Saturday. Upon walking in, there was no hostess to seat us. Not a great start. When she finally did show up, she seemed hesitant to seat us. I know it closes at 11 on Saturday, so I don't know what her deal was.  Within 5 minutes of us being there, the staff starts putting up all the chairs in the dining area. Way to make your patrons feel rushed and unwelcome. The waitress also took a while to refill our drinks. To top the night off, the kitchen was playing some illicit rap music that said the word, "motherf*****r". Last time I checked, Red Robin was a family restaurant?? Next time, wait until all your customers are gone before bumping NWA.  Food was not bad, but the service and overall experience I had was terrible.

I didn't hate the experience here. Nice staff and cool atmosphere. But I thought burgers are just burgers and price was really high. My son and I had 2 burgers, regular fries, and 2 drinks. Tap was almost $40. We should've gone to some place better if we were to spend $40.

My son loved his pizza. My burger was ok. The beer on tap was flat and not very cold. We were seated quickly and the greeter was friendly. Our waiter at was slow and not very aware of our needs. Had to ask for napkins, field and refills. We won't be coming back any time soon.

Wish I could give it "0" stars. We have been coming here for years it's one of our favorite spots. Well not after last night! The worst service we have ever had. The waitress was way to busy visiting with her friends on another table than she was about working. We had a party of 12 to celebrate my sons graduation. We waited for about an hour and a half to get our food. Half of our drinks never arrived. The food was under cooked. RAW burgers. We had to ask for silverware that took another 15minutes to arrive AFTER our food finally came!! When we asked for more fries, they never arrived. But when the bill came the waitress asked if we wanted a "to go box" of fries?? Really!!! Don't waste your time or money! We will NEVER be back! They just lost a long time customer!

I wouldn't recommend this restaurant the clam chowder look like puke. The fish and chips made me sick to my stomach too much grease. The French onion soup had enough salt in it to kill a horse. I would never eat there again

I have only been one time, I had a bacon cheeseburger with avocado. I loved it.  The fries were great too.  The service was slow, but we were in a large party of 10.  The menu had a lot of burgers that I really want to try so I will be back!!

My birthday burgers never fail to arrive year after year. The quality of the burgers are consistently yummy as well as those endless garlic fries. This place beats slaters 50/50 any day in my opinion. Recently have a new found obsession with fried mushrooms and they have some of the best. Love being a royal member as I get discounts. As much as I would love to eat here all the time it probably would not be a good idea haha. They do have some healthier options and offer veggie, turkey and chicken options for your patty as well as salads and other types of sadwhiches. I can't say I loved this place when I first went but now it's a favorite but then again I never really went out to eat before.

Ordered the smoke and pepper burger and I couldn't even finish it. It was drenched in grease the bottom bread was soaked it instantly got soggy it was falling apart and meat was undercooked.So bummed about it

UPDATE Make sure to CHECK YOUR FOOD. Two of our meals came with hair in it. Our food came cold and the other two orders were made incorrectly. Also, our server was rude and ignored us for long periods of time. When we asked her for something, she would come back with an attitude and slam the stuff down on the table. We expressed our concerns with the manager, but that was like talking to the wall. The managers should also get training on how to handle disputes appropriately. We definitely will never go back. We will make sure our family and friends know about our horrible experience. So sad to see  this place turn to the worse. ----------------------------------------------- About 2 years ago, the service at this location used to be excellent. My family and I loved to come here almost every weekend. Unfortunately, the service has changed tremendously. It was more of a family environment. Now, the servers look unhappy and disconnected from the customers. They seemed bothered if you ask them for anything. They should remember that without customers their jobs are at jeopardy. The location may have been remodeled, but what needs a facelift is the customer service. Maybe train the servers to smile, engage and bring the food when it's warm vs being cold in more ways than one. Sad to see the change happen for the worse.

I will never go to this restaurant again.  After receiving my burger not the way I ordered it I had to wait 10 minutes for someone to come by to get it fixed.  They took it back to the kitchen and brought the same cold burger back out to me.  Why would I want a not fresh burger when they were the ones that messed up? I spoke with the manager Dan and he said this is common practice for them as they just fix the burger and return it.  He then brought me back a new burger that was so burnt that I couldn't even touch it.  No pink in there even though I ordered it with some pink.  Then he offered to cook it some other way.  What other way do I want them to cook it? Before this I was a once a week customer and I went there specifically for the burgers. If they suddenly don't know how to cook them the way they usually do then no reason for me to go back. Oh well. I'll find a new place that knows how to cook gourmet burgers, not just say they are a gourmet burger place. UPDATE: Customer service is a joke.  They contacted me right away after I wrote this.  Acted like they cared.  Asked for all my personal information so they could contact me and find out more.  Once I gave them my info, all they did was send me a form letter that they will use it as feedback to help for future.  Well if that was all they were going to send me, they could have done that from here instead requesting all my personal info that they obviously didn't care enough to use for other than a generic form letter.

This is a review on the burger I just had there. It was The DGB gourmet burger. I've eaten at many Red Robins over the years and have always enjoyed the burgers. But this one was the most bland burger I have ever had in my life. I kept trying to like it. Especially since they charge 13 bucks for it, but i just couldnt. The bun was nice and the toppings were ok. The problem was the meat. It had absolutely no flavor. I tried using the salt and pepper grinders that were on the table. Even the spicy ketchup that I was using for my fries didn't help. Sadly, i don't plan on returning. I can get a really good burger for half the price elsewhere. I'm giving 3 stars since my son enjoyed his bacon burger and our server Braeden was very nice.

My biggest complaints about this location are: 1. Speed 2. Service 3. Quality This is one of the slowest Red Robin's I've visited. It's located in an industrial part of town. Workers and businessmen have short lunch periods and management can't comprehend that. It takes 10 minutes for the waiter to show up and then 20 minutes for food to arrive. Counting the 10 minutes travel each way, that leaves 10 minutes to eat hot soup or fried food! And don't get me started on your fries. They are ALWAYS stale unless I ask for fresh ones and then it's another 20-minute wait. Get your act together RR! This could be easily be a go-to 4-star location!

I don't generally write reviews and I have had decent experiences at this location in the past.  However, my experience this evening demands a review if for no other reason then to provide constructive commentary that may be used in an instructive manner.  I ordered a southern charm burger, iced tea and a side of poppy seed honey mustard dressing.  I also asked for no onions, no lettuce and to have the burger on a kaiser roll (I know, a high maintenance order albeit one that has not posed any issues in the past). My order arrived on the wrong type of bun.  When I pointed out to the server that the bun was not what I ordered, he annoyingly said " I don't know if we have the kaiser rolls since we discontinued the burger it came on"....what?  I have ordered my burger on the kaiser bun since Red Robin began offering them (it has literally been years) - including last week at this very location.  He ran back to the kitchen to check and a few minutes later came back and said they did have the rolls did I want him to change it out....isn't that why I pointed out the mistake in the first place.... I said yes.    My burger came back on the correct bun but had more mayonnaise then I have ever seen on a burger...it must have had at least 2 1/2 tablespoons plopped on the top.  When I asked the server if the burger looked correct to him because if is the burger I always order and it had excessive amounts of mayo.  He told me it has always come that way.  When I told him that I order it all the time and it has never had this much mayo, he argued with me and said I was wrong that it has ALWAYS been saved that way ALWAYS! I gave up at that point, paid the 17 for my meal that I did not even bite into and left.   I will not be going back to this location, it was truly an awful experience.

This is our go to place to get a quick bite. Although inside the restaurant  is very clean, something needs to be said about there patio area. This is the first time my wife and I sat out here and it's not where you wan to eat. This area is very dirty. Tables and chairs are not clean. Webs are underneath the table and chairs. Cement floor looks like it hasn't been cleaned in a long while. This needs some attention.

I don't know why I consistently bring myself to chains that I am not a fan of. With saying this I found myself at this Red Robin. I must say I've had multiple mishaps at this location on previous visits but still decided I needed some "bottomless fires". We were seated as soon as we walked in and helped almost immediately but service went down very soon afterwards. We ordered and I asked if we can have some fries while we waited. They dropped off some garlic fries and we devoured them and waited basically until our food came and was ignored multiple times when we would of liked more. We ordered a salad and a garden burger, 100% my mistake I thought the garden burger was something else other than a veggie burger, so again waiting for an unnecessary amount of time when our waitress did walk by us multiple times before even asking us if everything was ok or if we would like a fry refill or drink refills. My boyfriend finished his salad before she walked over, so once she did I expressed my sadness that I didn't want a veggie burger I just wanted a plain ole cheeseburger. The only upside of that visit was that they had no issue swapping out my burger needs. Another 10-15 minutes or so and the cheese burger was dropped off with more fries, but again very awkward that I was sitting there waiting to flag down someone to tell them I would like to order something else and to ask if we can get a refill. I started to eat the burger which surprisingly was very delicious, it wasn't dry and had very yummy crispy shredded lettuce on top of the patty. So I reached over to take a nice big gulp of my beverage for it to still be empty and to notice that my "bottomless fires" were  also empty. It's literally the most uncomfortable situation to have to eye flag down someone to get attention, it's almost like they purposely avoid you. To avoid sounding like a horrible inconsiderate person, the restaurant was not busy, and if it were I would completely understand the lack of said service. Also in the middle of trying to make any type of eye contact with LITERALLY anyone who worked there; this extremely awkward person came us to with a half ass sales pitch to donate to some type of organization that Red Robin teamed up with. So verbatim "Hi we have a fundraiser happening today, uhhhhaa ummm want to donate?". With not knowing what organization this was with the lack of information this awkward person presented to us DURING our meal we politely stated that we didn't have any cash and did ask her if a donation can be added on to our bill she again lacked information and said she would ask and she was not seen again. So I have multiple issues with this,1. How is corporate ok with people coming up to customers during your meal to try and get cash donations when there is a booth in front of the restaurant also supporting this unknown organization? 1  1/2 DURING YOUR MEAL?!?! During the time I'm trying to savor my "bottomless fires" DURING?!?  2. This chick didn't know what her sales pitch was and lacked the information I actually needed to want to donate. 3. How is it that our waitress was missing and couldn't be located but this random Red Robin employee had time to go up to every table with her half ass sales pitch? In a nutshell, you won't get "bottomless fires", refills, service and you will get awkwardly approached by staff for other reasons. And I say other reasons because I'm still not sure what that lady was trying to us to donate to. 91 of 100- 2016 Yelp challenge

This Red Robbin location has Horrible service, if I could leave no stars I would. Ordered bar wings to start and 35 minutes later came out boneless wings not what we ordered. When our waitress came around we let her know we were given the wrong ones she took them and didn't even apologize. 15 minutes later the waitress comes back and says the wings will be out shortly. Asked if it will it be ok if we bring out your food first. At that point I told her to cancel the wings, the food came out seconds after, and everything was cold. Once again brought it to her attention  and didn't apologize, her response was oh really, I said yes thought I'd bring it up to your attention waiting about an hour for the food and it comes out cold. Bottom line, horrible service. Worst experience ever. Won't be coming back.

It was a very busy time and we sat in the bar. The service for most part was good. The issue I had was I ordered a speciality burger with peppered bacon and got plain bacon. When I asked about it, they sent new bacon with pepper ON it...I asked for a Tavern burger instead because I could have put pepper on my own bacon. What a disappointment  that they thought this was okay!

Red Robin is a great chain restaurant, but recently this Red Robin just has not been meeting it's normal standard.  I went to dinner with my husband the other night (Wednesday night) and we were seated immediately. We were seating at a lopsided table in the middle of a room with multiple big parties surrounding us. It was loud but no big deal. Then we waited.....and waited....and waited...no one seemed to want us as their table. I saw multiple people check on their tables multiple times before ANYONE even acknowledged us. If my husband was not so adamant about getting his chicken wrap, we would have left. There is no reason for customers to sit and wait for their server to acknowledge them. We didn't even get the "I'll be right back to help you", we just got ignored.  When our server finally helped us we were ready to order everything. That was the only time we saw her, besides when we were ready for the check, and even then she told us we could pay our bill on the tablet that was at the table, so did we even need her help at all besides telling her our order? I wasn't comfortable tipping her alot because she barely helped us. Does red robin spilt their tips with the food runners? I wish I knew otherwise I would have tipped 20% versus the 15% I tipped.  I just wish our experience was better from start to finish. Such a disappointment.

I love going to the RR I Whittier with my great grandmother. Been here several times with my girlfriend, and we love it. I usually get the Nantucket Seafood Scatter, and she will choose a random burger. We split the meals, and usually have a couple drinks. Always great service, and the rewards card definitely comes in handy!

Too expensive for what you get.  I think we're paying for the new decor.  The food is just ok.  Used to be one of my "go to" places...not anymore.  $3.29 for literally 3-4 spoonfuls of soup. I'm kinda sad about it.

This Red Robin location is great! Every time I come here my servers pay attention to us meet all our requests and our pleasant about it! Camren Connors was our server this time and he was great! Not only did he make us laugh but he was quick with getting our requests (i.e. French fries!) He is attentive, friendly, funny, and just an all around great server! Thank you so much for making this dinner superb!

My go to place for a sit down restaurant with kids.  When u walk through the front door, don't expect to get greeted or even a smile. But the minute you go back, everyone is great back there. They only have like 2 round booths, so if your family is big with kids, there's a little wait. We prefer the round booths... helps traps the kids in the center. LOL.  What's kind of a disappointment besides the unfriendly front door girls, was that they ran out of chalk for the kids to draw on the boards or the wall.. eh.  Foods great, desserts great, waitress are always friendly. --just not the front door girls.

Just got take out for my mother and sister, absolute trash, my mothers fish and chips were so small compared to ordering in store, my medium rare burger was burned to a crisp, and my sisters chicken wrap was mostly tortilla they obviously only care about the people dining in, which is what we normally do but after this we will not be returning and do not support that type of favoritism, food should be the same for l customers.

My family and I eat out practically every meal. We've become accustomed to certain restaurants as well as some specific waiters/waitresses at each. One of the places we frequent is Red Robin. We love this particular location and many of the servers there. The burgers are fabulous as are the soups and salads. We have, had an off night on occasion but most of the time our expectations are exceeded. One of my favorite burgers is the Banzai. It's deliciously prepared with cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomato and grilled pineapple smothered in teriyaki sauce. Of course, they have a chicken version of this as well, for those who don't like red meat, and it is equally as delicious. The tower of onion rings is a great appetizer. For those of you looking for something a little lighter, I've had all of the soups and salads and cannot complain about any of them. The Chicken Tortilla Soup as well as the Clam Chowder are both fabulous. As for the salads, my top three would be the Southwest Chicken, the Avo-cobb-o, and my favorite the Apple Harvest. My 5 year old son loves the kids meals, especially the Mac It Yours (Mac N Cheese) and the Chicken Stickens and my wife's favorite meal is the Clucks and Fries (Buzz style).  Most importantly though are the servers. Always pleasant and helpful. Tara, Brayden, John, and Jasmine are our favorite servers. They are always cheerful and try to take care of us to the best of their abilities. I would definitely recommend Red Robin, Cypress to anyone looking for a good burger, and great atmosphere in a family oriented setting.

One star for good taste of the food and the nice little server named Tori ( not even our server), or it would have been 0 stars. I have never felt so I unwelcome to a place in my life! I never write a bad review but this place deserves it.. I don't know if it was the color of our skin, or because we were overly dressed from visiting santa, or because we have 4 kids but we waited a fairly long time to get our food ( the place was not even 1/3 occupied) and what they call bottomless fries should be called wait till your done with all your food or till it's cold so you can feel awkward when you  do ask for more.. and wait best part when walking out you hear another serve asking there table if there kids wanted balloons while my kids just heard.. smh so sad.. I will never take my money to this location ever again.

Generally, I love Red Robin. This location was complete shit, pardon the french. The dishes and utensils were nasty, the tables smelled nasty, the "endless fries" were ALL cold and stale. It also took forever to get our food to the table. We had to continue to ask for nasty ass fries thinking MAYBE we'd get a fresh batch. NOPE! The health department needs to pay them a visit and shut their asses down. Horrible place to dine.

First time being in this area and decided to try out Reed Robins. Our waitress was very friendly always checking up on us too see if we were okay. The food was delicious. I got the smoked pepper burger and also ordered the cookie shake which was really good. I wish I could of ordered other things but its a little pricey. I will definitely be back to try more.

Meh. Their burgers are pretty much all the same and very high in calories. I'd rather have a double-double than any of the burgers here. Their cob salad is good, and their BBQ chicken wrap , or is it whiskey chicken wrap? Other than that, there's not much to rave about. They do have a great selection of beer though...
Royal red robin burger and bottomless fries!!! Yum! They have really good salads and sandwiches here as well. Id recommend the onion tower and a cup or clam chowder.

Crappy food, crappy service, and restaurant is cover in grease and food.  Looked between booth and wall and lots of food from weeks of not cleaning.  French fries were soggy amd under cooked.  Will not be back.

This is average as Red Robin goes.  The staff is young and could use some polishing.  The bar service is a bit slow.  Recommend the Clucks and Fries.  If the dining room is full opt for the open seating in the bar if your party is adults.

Worst customer service I've ever experienced. We called 2 hours ahead for a group of 30 @ 7:30...the kid that answered the phone told us it would be about a 45 minute wait because there were other groups ahead of us. I then asked if we show up by 8 - 8:15 if we could be seated then based on the wait - "YES" was the response she gave me. We then show up at 8 with 30ppl to be told it's an hour wait. The manager was no help, slightly sarcastic and quite frankly didn't care. We then find out they did have an area for us outside that they gave to the WRONG group but we weren't supposed to know that. Because they were busy the 30ppl that left meant nothing to this incompetent manager, that made it clear she could care less. I like Red Robin but if you have choice choose another location. - now I can see why this location is only 3 stars and that's generous!

It was very busy yesterday but they seated us pretty fast. The service was great as well(Thanks Josie!). Food was great. The manager was really nice as well. Also, ordered micheladas and they said they'd be happy to make them since they aren't on the menu, and they only charged us $3.50 each  !

I've been eating at Red robbin  for years, specifically the one in Cypress on katella. In the last say three years or more, the quality of the food and the service has gone down drastically!. Mostly the food, especially  when you're  there for a birthday party, and a child has to wait for their food. Waiting longer than the adults to get their dinner, then getting an under cooked burger that makes them sick the next day.!! Tonight I ordered take out, im not surprised to say the order was all wrong, half the food was cold , big disappointment!! Ruined my Oscar nite dinner!!!! This restaurant really needs to up the quality  of the food served and the people who serve it, that don't know their menu. Proper training would help tremendously!! Even though the manager comped my dinner ,I wouldn't  recommend this place to anyone, and will no longer be eating there.

The food was great but the service well not so great seemed like the waitress had to many tables to serve and kept apologizing it took 45 mins to get our dinner and our dessert was missed, but the waitress was awesome
Satisfy your burger crave here and pair it with a beer . Can't go wrong... friendly service today with Valerie. Thanks!

Called in to ask about TV stations for a game my parents want to see. The girl who answered the phone was extremely rude and told me she didn't know what that was, and it was not going to be playing...without even checking. I had to ask her to check, and the placed me on hold without another word. Pretty crazy lack of customer service, and that's before even getting through the door. They'll see the game elsewhere. :)

So while I was enjoying my meal at Red Robin, I was reading the nutritional facts and the General Manager (Lora) walks by and asked why I was looking at it. "If your looking at that, your at the wrong place!"  She does not know me as a person to make this type of comment. Immediately I was appalled and unwelcome with this statement from the GM Lora. Mind you that I am a new diabetic and I am still learning how to eat out but with good choices in mind.  She really needs to think about what's she says before acting on it.  Jon our waiter was amazing, right now the only reason I would return.

Burgers are great but can get pricey in my opinion. Service is always warm and quick to fill a need. Child menu is reasonable and fills a little ones moderate appetite easily. We eat here often and have had service issues, regarding order accuracy, in the past a few times, thus the 4 stars.

Let me start by saying we are a total Red Robin fan favorite.  So I'm so sad to say that we were so disappointed when choosing the Cypress Red Robin for my Niece's softball win Saturday night to celebrate. Just a bad experience overall: 1st got there around 8pm not crowded at all and had to wait to be seated for a party of 10, that they clearly had enough servers and could have pushed after tables together or asked if we wanted to just sit near each other. 2nd when they did seat is it was outside (freezing) which we didn't say anything because they turned the heaters on (still cold)  but we just went with it 3rd a group of the servers saw us out there and all looked at us like ummmm ok who's gonna take that large party.  When someone finally did step up, she's was actually a sweet girl (best part of this post) 4th our food arrived and the fish and chips were overlooked very dry and chewy, the fish sandwich was the same way and the burgers were barely warm.  We usually have food left over to take home, we left everything there 5th so sad the took the Cerritos one away, that was our go to on a whim.  Will not be going back to Cypress ever

Excellent service food was really good very clean place my only but at this place the bar tenders suck s order a passion margarita had no taste at all ohh and I think he forgot the tequila too but I am definitely coming back but I won't order any drinks here maybe strawberry

We stopped going for several years. My son saw the commercial with mac n cheese burger so we had to try again---disappointed! The burger only had mac n cheese sauce hardly any pasta. They got our order wrong so they took out the burger on our bill. So that was nice. But the quality of the burgers were like McDonald's. $10 burger??? We will not return. Btw- it took a while for them to acknowledge that we were sitting and waited for drinks for a while. We frequent the Habit now. Forget overpriced Red Robin burger.

I never made a review ever on yelp, but this made me do it. My first order of fries were cold and stale, my second order of fries were warm and soggy, I had to ask for utensils, the waitress didn't get my order right. The only thing good was I had too many napkins. I do not recommend this place.

Went here with my husband to take advantage of the endless fries. We both ordered a burger and boy were we dissatisfied in so many ways! Ugh... 1. Asked the waitress if we could have a basket of fries while we wait for out burger - Never came out. 2. When we finally got our burgers, our fries were cold and tasted stale. Asked her to bring us new fries and those came back undercooked! 3. My burger had soggy buns! I could make better burgers on the grill at home. I came here expecting their food and service was as good as the one in Costa Mesa but I was wrong. I would not recommend this place and will not return.  Save your money and go somewhere else worth it.

Something seriously bad is going on at this Cypress Red Robins...last night (4/21) my wife, my son and I went to this restaurant for the first time...the first time we've gone to a RR.  We ordered three burgers, one with clam chowder, one with endless steak fries and mine with onion rings.  We all shared these foods between ourselves.  The burgers were good, the onion rings were good, the clam chowder was OK and the fries were cold and under cooked.  My son had a coke and my wife and I shared a blended strawberry Margarita.  We were half way done with our meal when my wife started feeling bad...I asked her what's happening... She said she was feeling light headed and dizzy and her chest was feeling heavy...I monitored her for a minute, she started feeling a little better then she started getting worse.  She asked to give her the keys to the truck.  I had my son walk her out to the truck...she was very wobbly and had to hold on to my son as they made their way outside.  She just wanted to leave so I, being left at the table, wanted to get the bill and get my wife home.  At this point I don't know the condition of my wife outside but I'm concerned.  I try to find our server so I can box everything up and pay the bill.  It's at this point that I start feeling light headed and feel like I might black out.  I couldn't find our server but did see the manager a table away setting it up.  I expressed to her that I wasn't feeling well and that my wife was outside feeling the same.  She asked if I wanted her to call 911...I said yes and then said that I needed to lay down on the floor next to our table.  This is when the spectacle started.  I've never had to lay down in the middle of any establishment.  The police and fire came and asked all the pertinent questions... "What's your name, date if birth, do you know where you are...count to four backwards".  At this point I'm starting to feel better all by myself and answer all questions with no problems... I'm more concerned about what's happening with my wife outside and I'm asking everyone to please go see if my wife is ok....they found her in the truck and she was feeling better.  The EMT asked if I wanted to go to the hospital and I said no...it was Friday night, the ER was the last place I wanted to go till 2am and beside everything was subsiding. I needed to go outside and find my wife...I found her with EMT in the truck, she was fine as well.  We signed off with EMT and paid the bill then left for home.  So, here's the reason I'm writing about this...we all shared the food between ourselves... The only thing my wife and I shared exclusively was the strawberry Margarita.  We continually kept telling EMT and the manager that we believed there was something wrong with the Margarita...to my continued amazement no one really wanted to care or think that that should be a concern.  EMT was doing their job, seeing if I wanted to go to the hospital or not and the manager was only concerned about getting me out of the restaurant and then paying the bill.  This experience was embarrassing and I did just want to go home and so did my family.  We paid the bill, all the while, reiterating the idea that something was wrong with that drink. The manager, blonde full figured, insisted on telling us that their products were gluten free and not wanting at all to accept any responsibility for my wife's and my symptoms that were the same and that subsided at the same time...she would not even entertain the idea that something could be wrong with that drink.  When I woke up this morning the first thing I did was to see if there were any yelp reviews about this store like my experience... I found none but did find many bad reviews. My only thought about this is to warn others.  I'm just glad it wasn't worse.  Unfortunately I can never know what was inside my wife and I because we didn't go to the hospital but it is something that's lingering in us a day after.  Be careful going to this Red Robin IT'S NOT SAFE... I think its safe to say we won't be experiencing a RR any time soon.

Lame management. I am standing up front, right now 9:19 PM for over ten minutes waiting to pick up my to go order. Manager/host says "be right with you" but never comes back. If I were a customer or group I would have walked out five minutes ago. Kudos to the bartender with the cute purple/pink hair for at least acknowledging me after seeing I was waiting, and waiting. No wonder why you have a smattering of poor reviews piling up. It starts at the top. I've worked in many restaurants - move that girl up. Manager should be fired. As I type another customer walks in and has been waiting for five minutes with no manager/host in site.

I usually love going to Red Robin and have a few favorite meals I like to choose from. Tonight I decided to order take out for my husband and myself. He had a whiskey river burger and said it was fine but they gave hardly any fries and they were lukewarm at best. I spent more money on a gourmet burger and got the southern burger on a wheat bun with no onions. What I received was a very sad representation of a burger that is usually very yummy. As you can see from my picture, the bacon was regular and not candied as described on menu and I know there was only a minor amount of one of the two sauces they describe on the menu along with a little wilted lettuce. I had a few bites, there was no flavor so I tossed it, it was really just gross and along with the few lukewarm fries they tossed in, the meal was a bust. Will probably never try takeout from them again. I guess I will have to go in to ensure a correct order. So disappointed.

Wow!!! What an underwhelming experience! Service was friendly but ssslllooowww...food was disappointing and not very good. Who ever they hired to do their advertising should get a big raise because the only reason I came here was because of their commercials. Not the worst dining experience I've ever had but I definitely will not be back.

Our server Linsey(not sure if that's how u spell it) who has bluish grey hair with a pink hair band is awesome!!!!!!  She was very friendly and top of things. Made it easy to come here today to enjoy their burgers.  Excellent service!!! Happy to stop by here!!!

I dont understand all the negative reviews. We have been to this location 3x's in the last two weeks, and have only have great service. Sorry....don't remember any servers names.  The first visit, my husband and I decided to go. Ive never been. We were seated promptly. The second visit, my husband and I sat in the bar, and the 3rd visit, we went with another couple. All 3 times, we had great, and prompt service, and the food was awesome. Im over the moon happy that they have other, healthy options other than endless fries. Like endless steamed broccoli, or endless salad. Anyways,,,,,,I will write a more detailed, updated review on my next visit. I will then review the food a little more thoroughly. Its definitely worth a visit. I don't get the negative reviews. Check it out. Its yum.
I would go to this place EVERYDAY if my bank account let me. Amazing service, delicious food, and great parking. One thing, the inside may be a bit loud and price can be a bit hesitant.

We get to kids meals meat balls and hamburguer and my girls love the food and the vanilla shakes and for me a hamburguer was my first time here and its deliciuos the bun its wow i love the taste our waitress its so perfect. He always check the table and get refills i think his name its adolfo we came monday around 3 pm thank u amazing costumer service

Let me preface this by saying this is my first ever negative yelp review.  I ordered a salad and the salad had a lady bug in it. I work in a restaurant, this kind of thing is basically unavoidable and will happen once in a while, I get it. However, my issue was with the way this was handled. When I notified the server she was apologetic, which I appreciate, but she didn't remove the plate. Why would you leave a plate with a bug in it in front of a customer? After about 10 minutes the manager comes over and asks if there's anything he can do. Why should I be thinking of what you can do for me? I'm not managing the restaurant. Then he elaborates and offers a free appetizer or dessert which I declined. Then he walks away and still doesn't take the plate! As someone who has worked in the food industry for many years, that's customer service 101! If someone finds a bug you take the plate immediately and comp it, no questions asked. The manger then took $4 off the salad. I honestly can't believe I just paid for a salad that had a bug in it. Clearly management doesn't care or have enough experience to know how unacceptable that is.

Great staff!! Elena has helped me the last couple of times I picked up food for lunch. She is AWESOME!!! I've been going to this location for years but it wasn't until Elena started helping me with my takeout orders that I realized just how helpful she is. She deserves a raise. Food is exceptional too.

Came here to celebrate my co-workers new job and it was busy for lunch on a Tuesday. I like how Red Robin has their bottomless fries and they have a variety of burgers to choose from. I ordered a croissant but regret getting a burger because they looked so good & it was confirmed by my coworkers.  Next time I'm getting a burger

My fiance and I came here today, never been to this location. Came on Yelp and seen some negative reviews. Our visit was absolutely great, everyone was friendly, the service was prompt and the food was great. We sat in the bar, the bartender Elliot waited on us and he is great with customer service! We are happy with everything Red Robin provided for our visit today definitely will come back again. Great Happy Hour prices and they have it everyday!

Usually love red Robin but not to crazy about this location. First of, one of the hostesses was snobby. We asked if we could have a booth but looked at us like she was annoyed.  But whatever.. Anyways, I ordered a regular burger with the garlic fries.. Food came out at a decent amount of time. But sooo greasy. Looks like they didn't even drain the fries. Like too them straight from fryer to the plate. Burger was just ok. Very greasy as well.. Will not be coming back here for a very long time. I'll stick with five guys or the habit!!

My family came here very recently and I was apalled at our experience. It took the waitress (Elena) 15 minutes to start taling our orders. She took both drinks and food, while numbering us. She seemed confused by the whole thing. The food came pretty quickly so that was good. Although, the kids meals were cold, two orders were wrong and one burger was badly burnt. At the end the waitress tried explaining that she "gave up 3 other tables so she could take our party in."  The nerve!  I could forgive and look over bad food and service. But this place has a lawsuit waiting to happen. No toilet paper in the ladies room, and 3 customers had gone in to ask, twenty minutes in between askings. The hallway was about 3 feet wide, and in front of the entrance was this huge puddle of liquid. It had been like that for about an hour that we were there. They finally mopped all the mess up and gave is a dirty look when we tried to leave the bathroom to get back at our table. Last but not least the other servers walking around were rude. We told them if they could please put toilet paper and they shot back a look like "Okay? What do you want me to do about it?" The payment was horrible  and messy I would definetly not ve coming to this Red Robin and instead going to the one in Anaheim

The wait for a table was not too bad for a Friday night, waited about 15 mins or so and was taken to a table that was soaked from just being wipes down. Waitress was nice and attentive and the burgers was good and the fries were ok. Love that they have the terminals at the table to pay for your meal after you are done eating instead of waiting or asking for your bill. Pay and add a tip and be on your way.

If you like to wait a LONG time for take out orders go to the Red Robin in Cypress.  They say, "Third time's the charm" Oh, Yes, this has happened at least 3 other times. Goodbye Red Robin, I'm going to miss my favorite burger and onion rings:(

So after a long day at the beach with two very hungry teenager's with us; we finally arrived @Red Robin (Cypress,Ca.) and were pleasantly and promptly seated. Our waiter for the evening was Elliot and honestly we have never had a better server at any other of the locations!

Third time coming here... and now I'm over it. Drink took awhile to come out, asked for fries prior to receiving burger (didn't come out), felt like the server forgot about me. When she took the order, she said something like, "Would you like anything else so I don't have to walk back and forth?" Note: I just placed my order and this is the first time talking to her. 1st time ordering a shake too, it was crap. Burger was quite raw in the middle and the meat looked and tasted like a cheap frozen patty(the tavern burger?), not the hickory burger I ordered. UPDATE: Also, it's been about 12 hours and I have a freaking sick headache. When I got home I just layed down took a long nap because I didn't feel well. - Anyway, Anaheim location is much better.
Went here with three family members on Wed, Aug 16.  My burger and fries were COLD!

location: Corona Del Mar, Newport Beach, CA
review: Service received in their outdoor patio was great! Brianna gets  stars! Welcoming us and , answering questions about the menu, bringing refills without even been asked. Strawberry Lemonade with real strawberries was what we needed on a 95°F weather. My A1 Peppercorn Burger which I order well done on a wheat bun, was perfect and not dried up. I would order it again. Husband had a Bacon Guacamole Burger on wheat and he liked it. The fries? Ok. We have been there about 6 times in the last couple of years. It's my favorite sit down friendly burger place; not only the employees, but also the customers seem happy. It must be something in their food!

Red Robin may be slowly declining the sales over the past 5 years as more and more chains are closing down. The one in my city mall was replaced with a Chipotle. I went to this chain because my friend and I were shopping at Costco and wanted burgers so said why not.  First impressions is that they have very young staff, this is always good to see the young generation working and taking on responsibilities. We were seated quickly and another server immediately went up to our table to get us drinks and ask if we were ready. I ordered a burger which comes with endless fries. You definitely should take advantage of the endless fries because there are pretty good, lots of potatoe in each fry. Also, the burger only comes with like 6 pieces so go figure.  The service was great all in all, the seating area was spacious and bathrooms were clean. I don't have any complaints other than the employee who may have been the manager going to each table trying to convince us to join their rewards program.

We just got home from having dinner here and sadly to say it was not a very pleasant experience. The service was horrible. Our waitress was not attentive. It took forever for the waitress to take our drink order and food. We already knew what we wanted so when she finally did ask about drinks, we told her we were ready to order our food. There were 3 of us in our group and she only took 2 of our orders and walked away. When she came back with our drinks, my friend had to place his order. I have never waited so long to receive burgers. also it was dropped off by another worker and our waitress never came to check on us. My husband never received a refill on his "bottomless" soda and never once did she ask if we wanted more "bottomless" fries. We had to catch her attention to ask for our check and she just pointed to the tablet on the table. I am very big on customer service but this evening it was lacking. I don't plan on returning to this location even though it's only 2 blocks from my house.

Food is pretty consistent, but service is a hit and miss. Majority of the time, they're pretty good. My favorite burgers are the sautéed shroom burger and the burnin' love. I also really like their veggie patty. You can't really tell the difference when you're eating their veggie patty and the regular beef patty.  Pros: food is always good Cons: service isn't always consistent  Either way, we still come here since it's the closest Red Robin to our house.

I ordered takeout at the Cypress Res Robin on Thurs Sept 7th.  The waitress that took my order was very friendly and provided excellent service (it was her last day).  My order consisted of a prime rib dip with garlic fries.  While waiting for my order I waited in the bar and had a drink. My waitress brought me my order and a to go cup of French fries, the fries were hot and delicious. Up to this point I would have given 5 stars.  When I got home (mind you I only live 3 minutes from the restaurant) and opened my to go order the fries were cold and hard and the bread on my prime rib dip was burnt. I called the restaurant and spoke with my waitress, she offered to have my order remade it if I would like to come back and pick it up. As it was already 9 o'clock at night I decided not to go back however she did say that she would have the manager give me a call. As I am a rewards member I find it unacceptable that the manager has taken no action regarding this. And as a rewards member this store has my name and phone number attached to my order.
Basic. We came here for lunch before heading back home. Nothing out of the ordinary in either direction. The staff was nice. Food was good. We would come back.
Terrible service. Waited over an hour for a 10 year olds birthday dinner and never got seated. Zero stars, will never return nor will the other 14 people.

I knew this would be a bad experience when I saw how backed up the front of the restaurant was.  The hostess appeared extremely flustered so I assumed it was busy.  To my surprise the dining area was almost completely empty.  The waiter was obviously in a bad mood, he was clenching his teeth while taking our order.  It took him so long to actually take our orders that we knew exactly what we were going to get: two wedge salads to start and two burgers.  I ask for dressing on the side because I find most places are heavy handed on the salad dressing.  The manager actually brought out our salads and sure enough both are drowning in ranch dressing, mine with an additional side of ranch.  Unfortunately we were not given utensils by this point, as soon as we are given utensils, here comes the manager again with our entrees.  My friend asks for two sides of campfire sauce (which we asked for when we placed our order) and the manager returned with one.  Our burgers and fries were cold by the time we finished our salads and at this point both of us were over it.  Poor service, inattentive staff, and apparently incapable of listening to simple requests.  This was my second time eating at this restaurant and it will be my last.

Came here for a quick lunch with coworkers. Service was fast & pretty good until it was time to pay. It took our waiter a while before picking up our check, but he was only 1 of 2 working that area, so it's understandable. Food was good and cheap.
Definitely won't be back at this one .. took a hour for food waiter wasn't to be found for at least 30mins of us sitting and waiting and food was just not appealing or appetizing..

Been to this location twice with my aunt since moving to the area. The first time was good so thought why not to the second time.  The second time, the service was fine but the the food wasn't.  The bacon did not taste good, that I pulled it out of my sandwich. The seats the booth need to be replaced, Windows need to be wipped down and the outdoor patio needs to be cleaned (there were spider webs everywhere and they aren't planning for halloween). Definitely won't be back to this location again.

Sooooooo disappointed !!  Ordered for pick up,  not only did I not get all the condiments that I specifically asked for,but  one of the burgers was missing the patty, yes, the meat patty.  Another burger was missing the cheese.   Nikkia who took my order was so sweet and confirmed my order about 3 times. Do not see the point of that since they still got it wrong.  I called the store and spoke to Hector the manager... he just seemed blah about the burger missing from my burger. said he "will speak to corporate about sending me a gift card."   This place needs HELP

I didn't eat here I was just picking up a Postmates delivery. The waiter who helped me was great. He placed my order and while I was waiting he brought me fries while I waited. The food was brought out fairly quick from placing the order. Good customer service!

Red Robin burgers are always tasty, sadly the service is pretty slow. I've been to this one and the one nearby Disneyland, and for sure the one nearby Disneyland is quicker and more attentive. If you ask for extra fries you may have to finish your meal and get a dessert before you see those fries.

3 stars for the food. Whiskey burger was good. Onion rings were crispy. Fries were ok. I'd give a minus for service. To bad the service wasn't attentive or we'd frequent this place more often. Why there wasn't a manager checking the floor I haven't a clue.

I haven't been to Red Robin since the 70s and tonight, as I was driving by, I remembered the name, so I stopped in to see what they're like now. What a change! They've gotten much better! . I ordered the A.1.® Peppercorn Gourmet Burger, which comes with Bottomless Steak Fries. The online menu description says: "Gourmet burger joint or five-star steakhouse? It gets confusing with the hardwood-smoked bacon, melted Pepper-Jack, A.1.® Peppercorn Spread, tomatoes and crispy onion straws on an onion bun, making this burger worthy of five stars".  When I read "worthy of five stars", I thought, "Yeah! Right! This, I've got to try!"  . My waiter, Tyler, and I got off to a shaky start after he delivered the food. I was disappointed, because it seemed larger in the menu than what I was getting. I think I made Tyler a little nervous, because he came back a minute later and asked me if everything was alright, and I nicely told him that it wasn't quite what I expected, because, somehow, I thought it was going to be larger.  . Tyler had a professional attitude. He apologized and asked me to taste it and offered that if I still wasn't satisfied, I could try something else that I may like better. I was very impressed with Tyler's professionalism, as it's not very often nowadays, so I changed my mind about just eating it and never coming back. I decided, instead, that I would eat the hamburger, and if I didn't like it, I would come back another time to try something else, because I liked the service I was getting. . Tyler did something else that impressed me. When he first took my order and asked me if I would like something to drink. I said water, because I didn't feel like drinking a soft drink at the moment. Being professional, he didn't give me a sour look, as I get from some places. Instead, he impressed me by asking if I would like a sprig of lemon in it, to give it some taste. I love lemon in my water, but never think to ask for it. I thought it was a nice touch that he would smile and ask if I would like the sprig of lemon too.  . The store menu is slightly different, and mentions that it is made of Black Angus Steak. That's better meat than what you get at regular burger joints. One bite and I could taste the difference! And with the A.1.® Peppercorn Sauce they cooked it with made it mouth-watering delicious! I couldn't believe how good a burger could taste.  . They call it a gourmet burger, and they have earned the title! It is so scrumptiously delicious, if I were with a date, I think I would have forgotten about her as I devoured it, salivating at every bite and thoroughly enjoying my gourmet burger. She could've "flashed me" and I wouldn't have noticed! Not now, honey! I'm enjoying my Red Robin gourmet burger! . When I was done and asked Tyler for the check, I asked to see the menu too, and he very graciously brought it with no questions asked. Then, I opened it and asked him to discuss it with me. He was very polite and listened as I saw why I was disappointed and discussed it with him. He said, upon seeing the larger than life picture, now he could see why I would be disappointed when I saw that it was just a regular sized burger, because the picture makes it look so much bigger. But it tastes so good! They just need to fix that picture, so they won't throw off other customers too.  .  Another thing I was disappointed with, was that there was just a handful of steak fries on the plate, with the hamburger. That was disappointing after I had read that you get bottomless fries, yet that was all they delivered. However, when I was quickly finished with my fries, Tyler asked me if I would like some more. I said yes, thinking I was going to get another handful of steak fries. Was I surprised! He brought back, not a plate, but a basket, that was filled with steak fries! So many I could hardly eat them! . I left, a very happy customer. I was stuffed, it was mouth-watering delicious, I had savored every bite, and Tyler was very professional--being very polite and courteous. What more could I ask for!

Probably the worst experience ever. The water was bad tasting, they put the straws themselves which caused concern for hygiene. I ordered boneless buffalo wings and they were extremely dry and the fries weren't even that cooked. I suggest going to another restaurant if you want good food and experience. I suggest the islands in the Long Beach towne center. They're polite and friendly. They're food is awesome too.

Ordered boneless chicken wings plain.  No buffalo wings or bbq sauce.  What I got was the plain chicken wings with buffalo wings sauce all over my potatoes.  The sauce got all over the chicken wings.  I waiting for a long time for them to replace my order.  The person I was with had all ready finished his meal by the time I got mine. This is not the first time that we have had a program with our order at this location.  Used to be a great place.

Not doing this review so much for the food- which is always good, old-fashioned American diner grub - but because I had incredible service by my server Adolfo who really loves to serve the customer. He practically read my mind before I even needed to ask for anything- and he stayed on top of things even until the end of my meal. He was very responsive, quick to get some refillable fries (the campfire sauce can't be beat!), and just went way above and beyond average. He delivered Incredible service that is likely to bring me back again! (Even though I don't live super close).

Of all Red Robins there is to go to, this is the only location that I go to. I've been going here for about 5 years and there is never a dull moment. When I go here I always get the Buffalo chicken tenders. I definitely enjoy the fact that they have endless fries. You can never leave without saying you're full. One of the best places to go.

Terrible customer service. They told me that they would seat us in 20 minutes and 30 minutes later, told us it would be 15 more minutes. 15 minutes later told us that we had to sit outside but they had heaters. They sat us and didn't even bother to turn the heaters on. I had to go ask for them to turn them on. They didn't even bother to tell us that the heaters didn't work. We never saw a server in the 20 minutes we were sitting at our table in the cold. We just left and the staff was rediculously rude when we did. This is the 2nd time this location has been rude like this. Never eating here again.

So it's pretty nice eating there, but don't order to go. I paid extra for the fries to have the garlic/cheese on them and it was the saddest thing I've ever seen for $1.29 extra. Plus my burger was soggy and had no jalapeños in it. Also, my dad ordered extra fries and got the same sad amount of fries that I received. Don't order to go only dine in.

Very disappointed with Red Robin!   I went to Red Robin for the first time tonight with my family.   We waited approx 15 minutes before being seated, which wasn't to bad.    The waitress took our order approx 5 minutes later.   There were 3 people in our party and we didn't order anything out of the ordinary.   We waited at least 30 minutes for our order.    I requested no onions on my burger.  When our order arrived everything was cold!   I requested more fries since the fries on my plate were cold.   I was willing to eat the burger, although it was cold, until I noticed there were onions on  the burger!!  Come on.... it wasn't a huge request, right!? My Mother in law ordered the chicken wrap And soup, her soup was cold and wrap was soggy!!    While our food sat in the window waiting to be delivered the waitress decided to sing happy birthday to a customer, take the check for another table and THEN delivered our food ..... without giving us any napkins....how can you eat a burger with no napkins?! Don't think I'll be dining at Red Robin again!  Not a good first impression!  :/

It's been years since I've been to a Red Robin and I don't recall much about my last visit but over the weekend I did go to one on Katella Ave in Cypress. I ordered the Red's Tavern Double featured on a banner at the entrance for $6.99. It comes with endless fries, I also ordered a soda and a cup of clam chowder. The pictures all look great in the menu but like any menu it's hard to tell the actual size. This is where this eating experience takes a turn for the worse. The server was very polite and took our order promptly and brought us our beverages. We all ordered a cup of the clam chowder for $3.39, what a let down, it was the smallest cup of soap I've ever been served... maybe 5 ounces. Tastes wise it was OK nothing special. The Tavern Double is in the same boat as the soup, it's more of a kid's burger and as for the endless fries... well the server didn't come back until after we were done eating to ask if anyone wanted more fries... kind of late on that one. So for roughly $16 (including a $2.00 tip) I got a tiny meal that was so so... the four of us in my group all agreed that the food was not that good and the portions on what we ordered were too small... reminded us all of like kid's meals. So perhaps that's why I haven't been to Red Robin in years but now I know and I won't be going back in the future.

Love Red Robin ! Sad cerritos Red Robin closed but cypress is still close by !!! Theresa is the best server ever !! She's accommodating patient and super friendly with us on my birthday. Got my free burger !

My son and I went into this Red Robin for dinner and he asked for a well done burger due to a health condition. His burger comes out pink which he took a bite of . We mention it to the waitress and she says they will get a well done burger for him. They come back later and bring him the burger! We had to hunt the manager down at this point and she acts like we are crazy and says it was not the same burger which had the same bite my son took out of it..! Rather than argue we will not be returning to this Red Robin!!!

This is a fun go-to for date night, my partner and I really enjoy the atmosphere. Food is generally quick to arrive (looking at around 15 minutes, sometimes less), staff are very friendly and make sure to get your order down right. The restaurant is also very clean. I just did my first To-Go order recently and they made sure we saw our order first before we took it, including checking to see if the fries were warm enough.

I order my lunch here frequently and have always had an amazing experience. Teryn, my server was hands down the best server I've ever had. He was fast accurate and extremity friendly. Red Robin should hire more servers like him because he represents the organization phenomenally. I hope the management team at Red Robin takes the time to commend him on the superb job he is doing. I will definitely be coming back because of the great service. Keep up the great work!

Our first visit to Red Robin. The host in the front was super friendly and welcoming. Our server made us feel welcomed. He took care of us and made food suggestions. Overall, our food was delicious and the service was EXCELLENT. We will definitely be coming back again.

Don't come here...I don't know why I keep coming back to this place and why it took me so long to finally write a review for this particular Red Robins establishment; but today at 3:30pm, was my final breaking point.  My family and I walked in and noticed that this place wasn't busy at all. Besides their bar area, with about 5 customers, their dining area was pretty much empty. We didn't see a host or hostess at the front, so after waiting for about 5 minutes, we actually had to track down the hostess, she was in the kitchen for some reason, but we finally got seated. I had a feeling this was going to be a bad experience already, so I set my timer to see how long it would take the waiter/waitress to at least get our drink order. We noticed 2 workers setting up some tables and majority of their staff just chatting away and laughing in the kitchen. At the 15 min mark of waiting with not a single person coming by to take our drink or appetizer order; my family and I just got up and walked out. Before I walked out, I asked to speak with their manager (their manager at that time was Gus),  I told Gus that he really needs to step up their customer service, because this was just ridiculous. All he could say was sorry for the bad experience and went back to the kitchen. I just don't understand, their restaurant wasn't even crowded or busy, and they clearly had enough staff members.

My boyfriend, me, and his roommate ordered meals online to go (all on one order). They both ordered garlic herb fries which is $1.49 extra for both meals, and when we got home after we picked up the food, neither of their meals had garlic herb fries. I normally have no problems with Red Robin but I'm not impressed with them tonight.

This is our second visit to the Katella location. Both times the burgers have been awesome. Hubby had the Gourmet Cheeseburger both times. Today I had the Gourmet Bacon Cheeseburger and last time I had their basic Red Robin Cheeseburger. Endless steak fries are endless!! I would say my burger today was better than the basic burger but both were good. Topped it off with a beer and we left rolling out the door. Will definitely be back. Also, we used my 15% rewards coupon with no problem! Service was spot on!
Although the food was good, the wait was outrageously long,  the service was horrible,  and when they say they will seat you in a couple minutes they mean 20 minutes. Never coming here again.

This place doesn't even deserve 1 star! We came in at 11:15 am on a Saturday morning. The place was pretty empty since it just opened. The guy at the front said that we had to wait for a bit because all his servers were taking care of big parties that just came in before us. We ended up waiting for about 15 minutes to get seated and finally left. I don't understand why they  dont have enough staff for a Saturday. There were only a few parties that were seated in the restaurant and couldn't seat us because the few servers that were working were already helping the other parties. This was not our first bad experience here. We've come often on weeknights. We always end up waiting 20 minutes before someone even takes our drink order. We came Saturday when it opened thinking that we probably won't experience this problem but we couldn't even get seated!  The management at this location is terrible we probably won't be back again

Fantastic night! We came from out of town for the weekend and tonight was our final night, and my Mom's birthday and she wanted Red Robin. We came in with a large party and they were super busy, but we were willing to sit on the patio so they accommodated us. The server Caitlyn was quick and on top of it! She kept up with drink refills and 8 kids asking for side refills. She was very pleasant and great with the kids. Our food came fast, the kids first, that was great! It was a perfect ending to our trip. Thanks for a good night!
